subject: Accenture Initiative for CHARUSAT Students ‚Äì Internship & Placement Assurance Program 2025
snippet: . Dear Student, Accenture, in collaboration with leading education partners, is extending participation in the Verified Internship and Placement Assurance Program 2025 to eligible students of Charotar
content:
I've invited you to fill out the following form:
Summer Internship by Accenture: Apply for the 2k25 Internship Program

To fill it out, visit:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfOI5NpjTjq-Ovm8bkQOAsck67jKea5A4ZEm82__5iHwY0gHw/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1&flr=0&usp=mail_form_link

Dear Student,

Accenture, in collaboration with leading education partners, is extending  
participation in the Verified Internship and Placement Assurance Program  
2025 to eligible students of Charotar University of Science and Technology  
(CHARUSAT). This initiative is tailored to enhance career readiness through  
structured training, practical assignments, and project-based learning  
guided by professionals from relevant domains.

The program provides a focused pathway for students to strengthen their  
profiles through resume-building support, interview preparation, and  
exposure to industry-aligned project tasks. On successful completion,  
participants will receive verified credentials acknowledging their efforts,  
issued in association with the program‚Äôs professional mentors and academic  
collaborators.

If you‚Äôve already shared your interest or submitted your details, no  
further steps are needed. Otherwise, if you‚Äôd like to learn more or  
participate, you are encouraged to respond to this message by 28th June  
2025. We welcome your interest in engaging with this career-oriented  
learning opportunity.

Sincerely,
Program Coordination Team
Accenture Verified Internship and Placement Assurance Program 2025

> Dear Students,
>
> Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We
> truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of
> our academic email classification model.
>
> As promised, your data will be used *strictly for academic purposes*, and *only
> informational emails* will be processed. Your contribution will also be
> acknowledged in our final presentation/report.
>

> containing:

> ------------------------------
>

> To make the process smoother and more efficient, we‚Äôll be conducting the *email
> extraction together over a single Google Meet session*. This will help
> save time and allow us to *assist you in real time* with any issues or
> doubts you may have during the process.
>
>
> link meeting:

>
> If you have any questions, feel free to reach out ‚Äî we‚Äôre more than happy

> Warm regards,

subject: Thank You for Your Willingness to Contribute!
snippet: Dear Students, Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of our academic email classification
content:
Dear Students,

Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We
truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of
our academic email classification model.

As promised, your data will be used *strictly for academic purposes*, and *only
informational emails* will be processed. Your contribution will also be
acknowledged in our final presentation/report.

To make the process simple, we‚Äôve prepared a Google Drive folder containing:

   -

   A script that will extract only academic emails from your inbox

üìÇ Folder link:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PbOQD_oKgAsZ9pWPrY62nWme5xyJr6JD?usp=sharing


üì§ Once the extraction is done, please upload your output here:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1NNd3t-VRDvEbDpGLDJOCsyBMA1t19Pdz?usp=sharing
------------------------------

‚ö†Ô∏è *Important:*
To make the process smoother and more efficient, we‚Äôll be conducting the *email
extraction together over a single Google Meet session*. This will help save
time and allow us to *assist you in real time* with any issues or doubts
you may have during the process.


link meeting:

www.meet.google.com/qqm-yenq-mbe

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out ‚Äî we‚Äôre more than happy
to help!

Once again, thank you for contributing to this student-led research
project. Your support means a lot to us!

Warm regards,
*Vansh Malani ‚Äì 23DCS056*
*James Dhandhukiya ‚Äì 23DCS023*
*Jugvi Desai ‚Äì 23DCS021*

subject: Fwd: Anti Drug Online Pledge 2025
snippet: Dear Students You are aware that CHARUSAT has established an Anti drug committee for the prevention/prohibition of use of Anti-Drug and Alcohol in and around the campus . Today 26th June is celebrated
content:
Dear Students

You are aware that CHARUSAT has established an Anti drug committee for the
prevention/prohibition of use of Anti-Drug and Alcohol in and around the
campus . Today 26th June is celebrated as International Day against
Drug Abuse.

All the CSPIT students are requested to take an online pledge by CLICKING
HERE <http://cbn.nic.in/en/pledge/> , download the pledge certificate.

Submit the details along with the certificate copy in the GOOGLE FORM
<https://forms.gle/cF542xymiwKZ6hqo9>  .


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Mahammadsoaib Saiyad <mahammadsoaibsaiyad.ee@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Jun 26, 2025 at 9:01‚ÄØAM
Subject: Anti Drug Online Pledge 2025
To: Dhara Milan Patel <dharampatel.ec@charusat.ac.in>, Arpita Shah <
arpitashah.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Megha Desai <meghadesai.cv@charusat.ac.in>,
Mrugendra Rahevar <mrugendrarahevar.ce@charusat.ac.in>, Hemant Yadav <
hemantyadav.it@charusat.ac.in>, Viral Panara <viralpanara.me@charusat.ac.in>,
Hemang Thakar <hemangthakar.cse@charusat.ac.in>, Nishant Koshti <
nishantkoshti.aiml@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>, Principal C.S.Patel Institute of
Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All the members of the Anti Drug Committee of CSPIT.

You are aware that 26th June is celebrated as anti drug day across the
world , to celebrate the  International Day against Drug Abuse and Illicit
Trafficking at CSPIT, CHARUSAT we will ask the student to take an online
pledge and get the certificate from the CENTRAL BUREAU OF NARCOTICS
website.

You are requested to send the below mail to your respective branch students
of 3rd , 5th , and 7th semester students. Ask them to take an online
pledge and download the certificate and also submit the pledge certificate
in soft copy in the form whose link is shared in the mail below.

 (Encourage all the students to take the pledge on 26th June Only, so the
date is visible in the certificate)

You are aware that CHARUSAT has established an Anti drug committee for the
prevention/prohibition of use of Anti-Drug and Alcohol in and around the

subject: Re: Announcement: New IEEE CHARUSAT SB Positions are now open for 2025-26
snippet: A gentle reminder to those who are interested to fill in for positions in the student branch. Please note that 30th june is the last date, so complete the procedure as soon as possible. On Mon, 16 Jun
content:
A gentle reminder to those who are interested to fill in for positions in
the student branch. Please note that 30th june is the last date, so
complete the procedure as soon as possible.

On Mon, 16 Jun 2025 at 12:56, IEEE CHARUSAT SB <
ieee.charusatsb@charusat.edu.in> wrote:

> üì¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members ‚Äì
> 2025-26
>
> Dear *CHARUSAT Students*,
>
> We‚Äôre thrilled to announce that applications for the *IEEE CHARUSAT
> Student Branch Executive Committee* and its chapter positions are now
> *open* for the academic year *2025-26*!
>
> This is your chance to be part of an empowering platform that nurtures *technical
> expertise*, *professional growth*, and *global networking*.
> ------------------------------
> üîé What is IEEE?
>
> IEEE is the world‚Äôs largest technical professional organization dedicated
> to advancing technology. Student branches offer a space for innovation,
> collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains.
> üí° Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?
>
>    - *Enhance Your Resume:* Engage in projects, workshops, and events in
>    domains like AI, Robotics, VLSI, Signal Processing, and more.
>    - *Global Networking:* Connect with professionals, mentors, and
>    students around the world.
>    - *Leadership Roles:* Lead initiatives and build real-world leadership
>    and teamwork skills.
>    - *Exclusive Opportunities:* Participate in events like IEEE Xtreme
>    and international conferences.
>    - *Access Resources:* Utilize tools like the IEEE Xplore Digital
>    Library to stay ahead in your field.
>
> üîó Student Membership Benefits
> <https://www.ieee.org/membership/students/index.html>
> üîó General IEEE Membership Benefits
> <https://www.ieee.org/membership/index.html>
> üß© Available Branches
>
>    1. Main Executive Committee
>    2. Computer Science (CS) Society
>    3. Women In Engineering (WiE) Affinity Group
>    4. Antenna and Propagation Society (APS)
>
> üìå Positions Available
>
>    - Chairperson
>    - Vice-Chairperson
>    - Secretary
>    - Treasurer
>    - Web Master
>
> Each position involves managing academic and extracurricular activities,
> promoting IEEE‚Äôs mission, and encouraging participation within the student
> community.
> üìù How to Apply
>
> Please fill out the Google Form below and note that the last date is *30th
> June, 2025*. The selection process includes evaluation of your responses
> and an interview later on.
>
> üìã Apply Now
> <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdRjH7KzS5k-HnAYka2T6sf1-Z1Jy9r5lmYifWWcA86FMKLtg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=102851502240872653276>
>
> We look forward to welcoming passionate student leaders into our IEEE
> community!
>
>

subject: MNC Industrial Internship 2025 || CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY || Talent acquisition ‚Äì Apply Now
snippet: Dear Student of CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY Congratulations on being Shortlisted for the Internship! Registration Closes Soon for 2025 MNC Industrial Internship We hope this message finds you well and focused
content:
*Dear Student of CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY *



*Congratulations on being Shortlisted for the Internship!**Registration
Closes Soon for 2025 MNC Industrial Internship *

We hope this message finds you well and focused on your personal and
academic goals.

*You‚Äôre invited to be part of the Career LaunchPad Program by LaunchEd
Global ‚Äî a two-month guided experience that blends structured learning with
real-world application. This program is designed to help students build
skills, deliver actual projects, and prepare for what companies look for in
future professionals.*
------------------------------
*What is the Career LaunchPad?*

A structured program built around the *Learn ‚Üí Apply ‚Üí Launch* model ‚Äî
ideal for students across Tech, Marketing, Design, and Data domains. You'll
work directly with industry professionals and apply your learning to real
projects and business scenarios.
------------------------------
*How to Apply*

   -

   *Pre-register here: *
*[https://forms.gle/charusat.edu.in <https://forms.gle/gW6UW5DWDzQQHRKF8>]
   Selected students will be contacted by our team.*
   -

   *Certifications/Internships Projects & Reports can be submitted to the
   departments for the Academic Credit Points (If it's required).*

------------------------------
*Program Structure*

*Month 1: Skill Foundation & Applied Learning :*

   -

   Learn from scratch ‚Äî covering basics to advanced concepts in your chosen
   domain
   -

   Attend live expert-led sessions across Tech, Marketing, Design, and Data
   -

   Gain exposure to in-demand tools like Generative AI, Low-Code Platforms,
   and Prompt Engineering
   -

   Complete *10 real-world mini projects* to apply your skills in a
   practical setting
   -

   Receive consistent mentor support and hands-on guidance

*Month 2: Business Challenge & Delivery Phase*

   -

   Work on *one real business problem provided by a partner MNC/startup*
   -

   Choose to work *individually or as part of a team*
   -

   Build and present a complete *Minimum Viable Product (MVP)*
   -

   Get structured feedback from professionals as you finalize your project
   -

   Add a tangible, high-impact project to your portfolio

------------------------------
*Post Program Benefits*

   -

   *Real-World Project Experience* ‚Äì Build practical work you can showcase
   -

   *Mentorship from Experienced Professionals* ‚Äì Learn with expert guidance
   -

   *Masterclasses by CXOs & Startup Founders* ‚Äì Gain insights from top
   industry leaders
   -

   *AI-Based Career Assessment Tool* ‚Äì Understand your strengths and career
   path
   -

   *Personalized Resume Reviews & Mock Interviews* ‚Äì Boost interview
   confidence
   -

   *Co-Branded Certificate & Letter of Recommendation* ‚Äì Enhance your
   professional profile
   -

   *Wipro Dice ID Verification* ‚Äì Adds credibility to your credentials
   -

   *Portfolio Building Support* ‚Äì Present your work in a professional format
   -

   *Access to an Alumni & Mentor Network* ‚Äì Stay connected and supported
   long-term
   -

   *No Prior Experience Required* ‚Äì Open to students from all academic
   backgrounds
   -

   *Soft Skill & Communication Development* ‚Äì Improve your ability to pitch
   and present

------------------------------

*We look forward to your active participation in the Training and
Internship Program. This is an excellent chance for you to broaden your
horizons and take a step towards a successful career. For any inquiries or
assistance, feel free to contact us. *

Warm regards,
*LaunchED Global Internship Team*

subject: Invitation to participate in celebration of 11th International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2025 (Saturday)
snippet: Dear All, We are happy to inform you that CHARUSAT has organized the celebration of 11 th International Day of Yoga at CHARUSAT Campus, Changa with a view to spread awareness about Yoga and motivate
content:

We are happy to inform you that CHARUSAT has organized the celebration
of *11th International Day
of Yoga *at *CHARUSAT Campus, Changa *with a view to spread awareness
about Yoga and motivate the practice of Yoga among all.  The detail of the
program is as under:

Various yoga steps will be practiced by the participants under the guidance
of the expert.



You all are requested to report at the venue at 9:10 am.

*Try **your best to attend the event*.

subject: Fwd: Emerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)
snippet: Dear Friends, IEEE Gujarat Section, along with Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya and IEEE KSV SB, is organizing a 2-day event ‚ÄúEmerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)‚Äù on July 26‚Äì27, 2025. The
content:
Dear Friends,

IEEE Gujarat Section, along with Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya and IEEE KSV
SB, is organizing a 2-day event *‚ÄúEmerging Research Trends in Engineering
(ERTE 2025)‚Äù* on *July 26‚Äì27, 2025*. The theme is *AI for Smart Cities and
Industry 4.0*.

Interested students can find more details in the forwarded mail below.
Regards,
Dhruv Rupapara

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IEEE eNotice <enotice@enotice.ieee.org>
Date: Tue, Jun 3, 2025 at 5:26‚ÄØPM
Subject: Emerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)
To: <dhruvrupapara@ieee.org>


If you are having trouble reading this message, click here
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=ND6C_G_4XR7QwsC0DN1gvYOvZ57b8ruOGT492fDy5UinE7tL911ili6B-6NrwdnFxyyA1OBe0eeYBZxh9tjRKA~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>
for the web version.

Dear all,

It is our pleasure to inform you that IEEE Gujarat Section, along with Kadi
Sarva Vishwavidyalaya, Gandhinagar, IEEE KSV SB is organizing a 2-day event
on "*Emerging Research Trends in Engineering (ERTE 2025)*" during *July
26-27, 2025.  *The event aims to provide an insight into industrial
practices, current research areas, and trends in the field of *"AI for
Smart Cities and Industry 4.0."* The event is supported by IEEE SPS, IEEE
CS, IEEE IES/IAS/PELS, and the IEEE PES chapter of the IEEE Gujarat
Section.

*Following are distinguished speakers of the event*

¬∑        Mr. Samir Bhatt, E-Infochip, Ahmedabad.

¬∑        Mr. Jugal Oza, E-infochip, Ahmedabad

¬∑        Dr. Mahipal Jadeja, MNIT, Jaipur

¬∑        Dr. Sudeep Tanwar, Nirma University, Ahmedabad

¬∑        Mr. Sohil Patel, Oizom Instruments Pvt Ltd, Ahmedabad

¬∑        Mr. Naveen Gupta, Deets Digital, Ahmedabad

¬∑        Mr. Vicrumnaug Vuppalaty, Fiscal Ox Cloud Pvt Ltd, Vadodara.



*Registration link:*  https://forms.gle/xbNDCXLbJk1zx4Y56
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=-hjM3BbMnc2OcId_rF5ruRICpNteDrR8xlQIK6vV9k7-mvVHi8DpnetQdYkm8Cyfdw6GyuUtVR0aTP5nS0_39g~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>

Website: https://ieeegujaratsection.org/erte-2025/
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=KqgBIsIwhMGgkP3p3F95_FjCDyeN-Bh5wevi0Lu0H0xsK3f0XlSc4k8WesNQ8i5XxTfKi9CT_hGBPmWZ8F2u6w~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>

   - *Fees for participation:*
      - IEEE Student Member: Rs. 400/-
      - Non-IEEE Student Member: Rs. 700/-
      - IEEE Professional Member: Rs. 700/-
      - Non-IEEE Professional Member: Rs. 1000/-



   - *Venue:* Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya, LDRP-ITR Campus, Sector 15,
   Gandhinagar.

On behalf of the IEEE Gujarat Section and Kadi Sarva Vishwavidyalaya, we
invite you to attend this event at *Gandhinagar*. Please find attached
herewith the flyer of the event.

Further, you are also requested to share this mail in your network and
among eligible audiences.

Regards

On behalf of Organizing Committee

ERTE 2025

IEEE Gujarat Section
------------------------------
Attachments:
ERTE CFP 2025
<https://enotice.mmsend.com/link.cfm?r=XPymsfUffb7PYPRLG7h95Q~~&pe=9DwJe9fePPfZHI2I1YMGEVWJMeVyzpky10D8dfJ_1FNqVcNFC6wZmOHPxA9YZ0VADwBrVrBt4Ukr2rs8_SvOEA~~&t=CNwiJ1nlky-5HZTdButDjA~~>

subject: Invitation to Participate in Online Quiz on 11th International Day of Yoga ‚Äì Organized by NSS-PDPIAS Unit
snippet: Dear All, Warm Greetings! On the occasion of the 11th International Day of Yoga, the NSS Unit of PDPIAS is organising an Online Quiz to spread awareness about the ancient Indian practice of Yoga and
content:
Dear All,

Warm Greetings!

On the occasion of the *11th International Day of Yoga*, the *NSS Unit of
PDPIAS* is organising an *Online Quiz* to spread awareness about the
ancient Indian practice of Yoga and its significance in our daily lives.

We invite all students, faculties, staff and CHARUSAT family members to
participate in this engaging and informative quiz enthusiastically.

*Date:* 17th June 2025
*Mode:* Online
*Quiz Link:* https://forms.gle/Pvc3gGbRbmEGZC6k6
*Time: *10:00 AM to 03:00 PM

*E-certificates* will be provided to all participants on or before June 19,
2025, via email.

The quiz aims to promote the importance of Yoga for physical and mental
well-being and to honour the spirit of this global celebration.

Let us come together and celebrate *Yoga for harmony and peace*.

For any queries, please contact: Dr. Rajesh V. Savalia, M. 94292 22899

-- 
Thanks & Regards,

--

subject: Announcement: New IEEE CHARUSAT SB Positions are now open for 2025-26
snippet: üì¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members ‚Äì 2025-26 Dear CHARUSAT Students, We're thrilled to announce that applications for the IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Executive
content:
IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch 2025-26
üì¢ IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch Call for Executive Committee Members ‚Äì
2025-26

Dear *CHARUSAT Students*,

We‚Äôre thrilled to announce that applications for the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student
Branch Executive Committee* and its chapter positions are now *open* for
the academic year *2025-26*!

This is your chance to be part of an empowering platform that nurtures
*technical
expertise*, *professional growth*, and *global networking*.
------------------------------
üîé What is IEEE?

IEEE is the world‚Äôs largest technical professional organization dedicated
to advancing technology. Student branches offer a space for innovation,
collaboration, and leadership across engineering domains.
üí° Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Enhance Your Resume:* Engage in projects, workshops, and events in
   domains like AI, Robotics, VLSI, Signal Processing, and more.
   - *Global Networking:* Connect with professionals, mentors, and students
   around the world.
   - *Leadership Roles:* Lead initiatives and build real-world leadership
   and teamwork skills.
   - *Exclusive Opportunities:* Participate in events like IEEE Xtreme and
   international conferences.
   - *Access Resources:* Utilize tools like the IEEE Xplore Digital Library
   to stay ahead in your field.

üîó Student Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/students/index.html>
üîó General IEEE Membership Benefits
<https://www.ieee.org/membership/index.html>
üß© Available Branches

   1. Main Executive Committee
   2. Computer Science (CS) Society
   3. Women In Engineering (WiE) Affinity Group
   4. Antenna and Propagation Society (APS)

üìå Positions Available

   - Chairperson
   - Vice-Chairperson
   - Secretary
   - Treasurer
   - Web Master

Each position involves managing academic and extracurricular activities,
promoting IEEE‚Äôs mission, and encouraging participation within the student
community.
üìù How to Apply

Please fill out the Google Form below and note that the last date is *30th
June, 2025*. The selection process includes evaluation of your responses
and an interview later on.

üìã Apply Now
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdRjH7KzS5k-HnAYka2T6sf1-Z1Jy9r5lmYifWWcA86FMKLtg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=102851502240872653276>

We look forward to welcoming passionate student leaders into our IEEE
community!

To:



Dear Sir/Madam,



We are excited to announce that *Tata Power, in collaboration with the
National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC)*, is launching comprehensive
Technical Training Programs designed to equip you with in-demand practical
skills and industry-recognized credentials.

(Certificate sample attached)*‚Äîenhancing candidates‚Äô professional

subject: Important Summer Internship Invitation _2024 Batch-Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat) Student [NSDC & SKILL INDIA ACCREDITED CERTIFICATION]
snippet: DEAR STUDENTS OF Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat) PROGRAM UNDER {NATIONAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION} X {SKILL INDIA INITIATIVE} [ JULY ,AUGUST & SEPTEMBER BATCH
content:
DEAR STUDENTS

OF
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (Charusat)*
 PROGRAM UNDER

*{NATIONAL SKILL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION} X {SKILL INDIA INITIATIVE}*
[ JULY ,AUGUST & SEPTEMBER BATCH REGISTRATION]
*Warm Greetings!*
*It is Important for Interested Students to submit their application, if
shortlisted you will receive a response from our HR Team:*

*Submit your Application*
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScgK518jqfIZh_Ho8xE6HknOcDEFKhT3J9oYCtQEEZW6fJZWg/viewform?usp=header>





*Program Overview:*

*First Month: Training*

   - Participate in live lectures and receive guidance from industry
   professionals.
   - You will receive login details after the Registration Process.

*Second Month: Internship*

   - Engage in real-world projects with professional mentorship.
   - *Project Details:*
      - *Individual Assignments:* Complete 10 unique projects with your
      mentor.
      - *Group Capstone Project:* Collaborate in teams on a capstone
      project, with specific roles assigned to each intern. All necessary
      resources will be provided by the company.

*Class Formats:*

   1. *Blended Learning:*
      - Access recorded sessions and join live doubt-clearing sessions
      every weekend.
   2. *Live Mentor-led Classes:*
      - Attend live Zoom sessions 2-3 times per week after 6:30 PM, with
      recorded sessions available for later review. You will also have
access to
      our Learning Management System (LMS) for six months.

*Certificates and Benefits:*

Upon completion, students will receive:

   - A *Certificate of Completion* in alliance with LaunchEd [NSDC]
   - Verified certificates through *Wipro Dice ID*.
   - A *Co-branded Internship Certificate* from leading MNCs.
   - *100% Placement Assistance* and entry to a growing professional
   network.
   - Training on *Low-Code and No-Code Tools*.
   - Curriculum focused on *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering*.
   - Exclusive *Masterclasses* with industry leaders.
   - Personalized mentorship for tailored guidance.



*Submit your Application
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScgK518jqfIZh_Ho8xE6HknOcDEFKhT3J9oYCtQEEZW6fJZWg/viewform?usp=header>*



*Best regards,*
*LaunchEd Global*

subject: Invitation to participate in 11th International Yoga Day - Online Debate Competition organized by¬†IIIM¬†NSS¬†Cell
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings from IIIM NSS Cell!!! To celebrate the 11th International Yoga Day, Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM) - NSS Cell has organized an Online Debate competition on
content:
Dear Students,

Greetings from IIIM NSS Cell!!!

To celebrate the *11th International Yoga Day,* Indukaka Ipcowala Institute
of Management (IIIM) - NSS Cell has organized an *Online Debate competition*
 on *June 20, 2025 (Friday).*



*Online Debate Competition ‚Äì Event Details:*

*Date:* June 20, 2025
*Time:* 10:30 AM Onward
*Theme:* Yoga for One Earth, One Health* (Topics to be provided one hour
prior to the scheduled start of the competition)*

*Registration Process:*
Interested participants are requested to register latest by *June 19,
2025* *till
12 PM* using the following link: https://forms.gle/Qzf1YCSnSnDxqFX68

*Online Debate Format:*
*The structure and flow of the debate will be determined based on the total
number of registered participants. Topics will be shared with participants
one hour prior to the competition.*

*Proposed Rounds:*

   1. *Preliminary Round:*
      - Each participant will speak for 3 minutes, either *for* or
*against* the
      motion.
      - Top-performing speakers from the preliminary round will advance to
      the final round.
   2. *Final Round (Crossfire & Closing Statement):*
      - A crossfire round will be conducted, where the selected
      participants will engage in a Q&A session with each other and the judges.
      - Each finalist will then present a 1-minute closing statement.

*Judging Criteria:*

   - Content & Knowledge
   - Delivery & Clarity
   - Rebuttal & Defence
   - Engagement & Time Adherence

*Certificates:*


   - Winners will be awarded 1st, 2nd, and 3rd prizes.
   - All participants will receive a Certificate of Participation.


Together let's make this International Yoga Day memorable. We look forward
to your cooperation at this extraordinary
International Yoga Day Celebration.



Please contact* IIIM NSS Coordinators: *Dr. Poonam Amrutia (+91 94295
58484); Mr. Brijesh Patel (+91 97370 23027) for further details.


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

subject: Invitation to Participate in Yogya 2025 ‚Äì University-Level Online Yoga Competition | International Yoga Day Celebration
snippet: Dear Students, Please find below the forwarded invitation from the CHARUSAT NSS Cell regarding YOGYA 2025, an exciting university-level online yoga competition in celebration of International Yoga Day
content:
Dear Students,

Please find below the forwarded invitation from the CHARUSAT NSS Cell
regarding *YOGYA 2025*, an exciting university-level online yoga
competition in celebration of *International Yoga Day 2025*.

Interested students are encouraged to participate and showcase their yoga
skills and creativity.

Regards,

(M) : +91 6353933976

(E) : dhruvrupapara.ec@gmail.com / dhruvrupapara@ieee.org

Profile :  Linkedin <http://www.linkedin.com/in/dhruv-rupapara>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Coordinator NSS Cell - CHARUSAT <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Jun 12, 2025 at 11:50‚ÄØAM
Subject: üåø Invitation to Participate in Yogya 2025 ‚Äì University-Level
Online Yoga Competition | International Yoga Day Celebration
To: <family@charusat.edu.in>, Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in
>
Cc: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>


*Dear Faculty Members and Students,*

Warm greetings from the CHARUSAT NSS Cell!

On the occasion of *International Yoga Day 2025*, we are delighted to
announce *‚ÄúYOGYA 2025: The Virtual Yoga Challenge‚Äù*, a university-level
online yoga competition organized by *NSS ARIP* (Ashok & Rita Patel
Institute of Physiotherapy) under the *CHARUSAT NSS Cell*, in collaboration
with the PHYSICAL EDUCATION & SPORTS SECTION.

This event is an opportunity to showcase your passion for yoga, creativity,
and mindfulness while celebrating the spirit of health and harmony.
[image: ‚ú®] Themes for Yogya 2025

   1. Yoga for the Mindful Generation
   2. Breathe In Positivity, Breathe Out Stress
   3. Stretch to Destress
   4. Unity in Diversity ‚Äì Yoga Beyond Borders
   5. Unplug to Connect: Digital Detox through Yoga

[image: üßò] Participation Guidelines

   - Submit a 1‚Äì2 minute video demonstrating 3‚Äì5 yoga asanas.
   - Choose any one theme and express it through your flow.
   - Top 10 participants will be invited to perform live in the final round via
   an online platform. (Zoom or Google Meet)
   - Entries will be judged on technique, flow, creativity, and thematic
   expression.

[image: üìÖ] Key Dates

   - Last Date for Registration & Submission: 16/06/2025
   - Final Round (Live via online platform): 19/06/2025 (Timings will be
   communicated - preferably evening around  6:00 pm)
   - Result Announcement: 20/06/2025

[image: üèÜ] Awards & Recognition

   -

   Best Yoga Performer (Student and Faculty)
   -

   Most Creative Flow (Student and Faculty)
   -

   Best Video Setup (Student and Faculty)

[image: üìú] E-certificates will be awarded to all participants.


[image: üì•] Register & Upload Your Video Here:
https://forms.gle/s7enhcCicAPNZ8N99


For any queries, feel free to contact:

   - Dr. Shreya Swami (PT) ‚Äì +91-6353651313 - shreyaswami.phy@charusat.ac.in
   - Dr. Disha Shah (PT) ‚Äì +91-9974790312 ‚Äì dishashah.phy@charusat.ac.in

We warmly invite all students and faculty members to participate in this
celebration of health, balance, and inner strength. Let‚Äôs bend, breathe,
and belong ‚Äî together !!

*Jay Hind !!*
CHARUSAT NSS Cell !!
*Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)*



-- 
Thanks & Regards,

subject: Re: Join the World Hackathon and Innovate Globally!
snippet: On Tue, Jun 10, 2025 at 4:43 PM Abcd Efg <efg5726@gmail.com> wrote: Hi Kevin, Get ready to showcase your skills and innovate on a global scale! The World Hackathon is just around the corner, and
content:
On Tue, Jun 10, 2025 at 4:43‚ÄØPM Abcd Efg <efg5726@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hi Kevin,
>
> Get ready to showcase your skills and innovate on a global scale! The *World
> Hackathon* is just around the corner, and we're inviting developers,
> designers, and innovators like you to participate.
>
> This virtual event brings together brilliant minds from around the globe
> to collaborate, learn, and build groundbreaking solutions. Whether you're a
> seasoned hacker or new to hackathons, the World Hackathon offers an
> incredible opportunity to:
>
>    - *Solve real-world problems:* Work on challenging tracks and develop
>    solutions that can make a real impact.
>    - *Collaborate internationally:* Team up with participants from
>    diverse backgrounds and expand your network.
>    - *Learn and grow:* Access workshops, mentorship, and resources to
>    enhance your skills.
>    - *Win exciting prizes:* Compete for recognition and rewards.
>
> ------------------------------
>
> *Event Details:*
>
>    - *Website:* https://world-hackathon.devpost.com/
>    - *Registration Deadline:* 14-06-2025
>    - *Event Dates:* 14-06-2025 TO 20-06-2025
>
> ------------------------------
>
> Ready to make your mark? Visit our Devpost page to learn more about the
> challenges, rules, and how to register.
>
> We can't wait to see what you'll create!
>
> Best regards,
>
> The World Hackathon Team
> [image: imagy-image.jpg]
>

subject: Request for Email Data Contribution ‚Äì Research Acknowledgment Included
snippet: Dear fellow student, We hope you're doing well. We are a group of students working on a research project focused on analyzing CHARUSAT student inbox data to train a machine learning model that can
content:
*Dear fellow student,*

We hope you're doing well.

We are a group of students working on a research project focused on
analyzing CHARUSAT student inbox data to train a machine learning model
that can automatically classify academic emails ‚Äî such as faculty
announcements, seminar notifications, class updates, and internship
opportunities.

We are reaching out to a few *handpicked students*, and we believe your
contribution could significantly strengthen the quality of our dataset. As
a token of appreciation, all contributors will be *acknowledged in our
final research presentation/report*.

Please rest assured:

¬∑       Your data will be used *strictly for academic and research
 purposes*.

¬∑        We are only interested in academic/informational emails, *not
personal content*.

¬∑        *No data will be collected without your clear consent*, and we
will *explain the data extraction process in detail* if you agree to help.

If you're willing to contribute or have any questions, feel free to reach
out. We truly appreciate your support in helping make this student-led
research a success!

*Note:* Please reach out to us if you agree by 15th June 2025.



Warm regards,

Vansh Malani, 23DCS056

James Dhandhukiya, 23DCS023

Jugvi Desai, 23DCS021

subject: "Internship_Career - B Tech 1st Year Students of Charusat University!"
snippet: Dear Student from Charusat University. Congratulations on being shortlisted for the Internship Program! LaunchEd Global in Collaboration IIT KHARAGPUR(Kshitij) is Organizing a 2-month Training &
content:
*Dear Student** from **Charusat University**.*

*Congratulations* on being shortlisted for the *Internship Program!*

*LaunchEd Global* in Collaboration *IIT KHARAGPUR(Kshitij)* is
Organizing a *2-month
Training & Internship Program with certifications from WIPRO Dice ID, IBM,
CISCO, META, and AICTE-approved.* Gain *industry-leading skills* and
*real-world
experience* to advance your career!

*Fill out the Google Form today to reserve your place in the program:*

                https://forms.gle/VWhzEk9Fp23BKQmV9
<https://forms.gle/ux9C9RpVqkDkcmf69>

*Join Our Official WhatsApp Group For More Information:*

     https://chat.whatsapp.com/HQlb0D2oAFl2Dfp4q9e3wR
<https://chat.whatsapp.com/ENKgO96eEfmD3PZz5aeM3V>

*Here is an outline of the program's structure.*
*1. Training Outline*

   - *Live Mentoring with Industry Experts:* Evening classes (6:30 PM -
   8:00 PM) are conducted live on the Zoom platform to fit your schedule. Get
   guidance at every step.
- *From Basics to Advanced:* Perfect for beginners and those looking to
   refine advanced skills, starting from scratch.
- *AI-Powered Development Made Easy*: Build applications with minimal
   coding, create innovative solutions using Generative AI, and easily design
   effective AI prompts.
- *LMS Access for Flexibility: *Recorded live sessions will be uploaded to
   the Learning Management System (LMS) and available for 6 months from the
   batch start date. Login credentials will be shared after registration,
   ensuring uninterrupted learning at your own pace.

*2. Internship Conduct*

   - *10+ Minor Project**: *The minor project is an individual project,
   where students will work on projects related to each topic they are
   learning.
   - *Major Project (CAPSTONE):* The major project is a group project, and
   you will work in a group of 3-4 interns, with specific responsibilities
   assigned to each intern. The company will provide you with all the required
   data and materials for the project.
   - *Resume Building*: Get expert guidance to craft a standout resume that
   gets noticed.
   - *Mock Interviews*: Receive feedback from industry experts to sharpen
   your interview skills.
   - *Masterclasses*: Learn from top leaders in global companies through
   exclusive sessions.

*Certifications Provided*

   - *Course Certificate*: Receive a prestigious certificate from
   IIT-KHARAGPUR(Kshitij)
   - *Internship Certificate*: Earn a certificate from our partnered MNCs &
   StartUps.
   - *Verified by WIPRO Dice ID*: Both the Certificates will be verified by
   WIPRO Dice ID
   - *100% Placement Assistance: *Join Our Growth Community for Direct
   Placement Support with Top Companies.

subject: Embrace Harmony: Yoga & Nature Session
snippet: Dear All, As part of the 11th International Day of Yoga (IDY) 2025 celebrations, CHARUSAT enthusiastically invites you to a week-long series of events promoting health, mindfulness, and environmental
content:
Dear All,

As part of the 11th International Day of Yoga (IDY) 2025 celebrations,
CHARUSAT enthusiastically invites you to a week-long series of events
promoting health, mindfulness, and environmental consciousness.

Join us for our special "Yoga & Nature" Session, designed to connect your
well-being with the serenity of the outdoors.

*Event Details:*

   - *What:* "Yoga & Nature" Session
   - *When:* June 16th to June 20th, 2025
   - *Time:* 5:30 PM to 6:45 PM daily
   - *Where:* Centre Lawn, CHARUSAT Campus

This session offers a unique opportunity to experience the profound
benefits of Yoga amidst nature, aligning with this year's IDY theme: "Yoga
for One Earth, One Health." Let's come together to foster holistic
well-being and environmental sustainability.

*Kindly confirm your registration by clicking on:  *
https://forms.gle/qoQfRvsiWWLv1Kmy7

*Who can attend:* All CHARUSAT students, faculty, staff, and the wider
community are welcome!

Please bring: Your own yoga mat and a water bottle.

E-Certificates will be provided to all participants.

Let's celebrate the spirit of Yoga and its connection to our planet. We
look forward to seeing you there!

*For more information, please contact:*
Dr.Pritesh Patel
-- 
Assistant Director of Physical Education and Sports
CHARUSAT Physical Education and Sports Section
(A constituent of CHARUSAT)
*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC, GOI*
*Accredited with Centre of Excellence by GOG*
Landline No: 02697-265036
Mobile : -- 97142 96999

--

this

agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended

subject: Invitation to Nominate Girl Students for WWT All India Women-Only Hackathon 2025
snippet: with regards: Dr. Dattatraya G. Subhedar Associate Professor, Department of Mechanical Engineering, Faculty of Technology & Engineering Charotar University of Science & Technology Accredited
content:
with regards:

*Dr. Dattatraya G. Subhedar*
Associate Professor,
Department of Mechanical Engineering,
Faculty of Technology & Engineering
Charotar University of Science & Technology

*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC*

*Accredited with "Grade A" by KCG*
Education Campus Changa -388421
Dist: Anand, Gujarat India

Phone Contact:
Mobile: 09712624320
(O): 02697 265227
Fax: 02697 247100






*From:* Atul Patel [mailto:atulpatel.mca@charusat.ac.in]
*Sent:* 06 June 2025 11:09
*To:* Principal <principal@charusat.ac.in>; Dean CHARUSAT <
dean@charusat.ac.in>; HOD Group <hod@charusat.ac.in>
*Subject:* Fwd: Invitation to Nominate Girl Students for WWT All India
Women-Only Hackathon 2025



For Information and action



Atul Patel

Professor, Dean (Academics) and Registrar

Charotar University of Science and Technology

Changa.

[image: image.png]



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: *Deepti Pillai* <deepti@sstarsfoundation.org>
Date: Fri, Jun 6, 2025 at 9:30‚ÄØAM
Subject: Invitation to Nominate Girl Students for WWT All India Women-Only
Hackathon 2025
To: Professor <atulpatel.mca@charusat.ac.in>



*Dear Professor *

I hope this message finds you well.

I am Dr. Deepti Pillai, formerly with CodeChef and currently serving as
Director ‚Äì Community at *Shooting Stars Foundation*, a non-profit committed
to advancing access to STEM education and entrepreneurship for underserved
communities.

We are delighted to invite your *girl students* to participate in the
upcoming
*WWT All India Women-Only Hackathon 2025*, organized in partnership with *World
Wide Technology*, a leading US-based IT services company.
Hackathon Highlights:

¬∑  *Open to all women college students* (any stream, any year)

¬∑  *Theme:* *AI for Financial Inclusion of Women ‚Äì Economic Empowerment &
Financial Literacy*

¬∑  *Mode:* Online

¬∑  *Team Event:* 4‚Äì6 members (*No team? No problem ‚Äî we‚Äôll help form one!*)

¬∑  *Prizes Worth ‚Çπ3,00,000 (1st/2nd/3rd/4th/5th prizes -
50K/35K/25/15K/10K). A*ll top 25 teams standing a chance to win a minimum
of ‚Çπ5,000

¬∑  *Hackathon Date:* Sunday, July 13, 2025

¬∑  *Last Date to Register: June 30, 2025*

¬∑  *Registration Link:* www.starhacks.org/wwthackathon2025
<https://email.shooting-stars-foundation.org/l/8ohqkV3IvFMrSSAZLmbOXg/1L3mRYYlKvNT1EbrEAqOBw/aznlpRaV3enicF4u4mWwng>

We would be truly grateful if you could share this opportunity with your
students or circulate it through your department WhatsApp/email groups. *A
brochure is attached* for easy sharing.
Institutional Recognition:

The college/university with the *highest number of active women
participants* will receive a *special mention* on our social media and in
exclusive communications to our corporate partners ‚Äî celebrating your
commitment to promoting gender diversity in tech.

Your encouragement could make a life-changing difference for your students,
empowering them to innovate, collaborate, and grow in a real-world setting.

Please feel free to reach out for any queries.



With warm regards

*Dr. Deepti Pillai*

*Shooting Stars Foundation*

*Bengaluru, India*

*LinkedIn
<https://email.shooting-stars-foundation.org/l/8ohqkV3IvFMrSSAZLmbOXg/m9a763HEpcykAcx90ar4Sjhg/aznlpRaV3enicF4u4mWwng>|
Website
<https://email.shooting-stars-foundation.org/l/8ohqkV3IvFMrSSAZLmbOXg/aznlpRaV3enicF4u4mWwng/aznlpRaV3enicF4u4mWwng>*



*If you believe you‚Äôre not the right recipient for this email, we kindly
request you to forward it to the appropriate point of contact in your
department.*
*To stop receiving further updates from us about our hackathons, please
reply with ‚ÄúUnsubscribe.‚Äù*

-- 


DISCLAIMER: The information transmitted is intended only for the person
or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or
privileged material which is the intellectual property of Charotar 
University
of Science & Technology (CHARUSAT). Any review, retransmission,
dissemination or other use of, or taking of any action in reliance upon 
this
information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient 
is
strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, or the 
employee, or
agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended 
recipient and/or
if you have received this in error, please contact the 
sender and delete the
material from the computer or device. CHARUSAT does 
not take any liability or
responsibility for any malicious codes/software 
and/or viruses/Trojan horses
that may have been picked up during the 
transmission of this message. By
opening and solely relying on the contents 
or part thereof this message, and
taking action thereof, the recipient 
relieves the CHARUSAT of all the
liabilities including any damages done to 
the recipient's pc/laptop/peripherals
and other communication devices due 
to any reason.

subject: CAREER LAUNCHPAD INTERNSHIP PROGRAM | CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Student of Charotar University of Science and Technology, We are thrilled to introduce the Career LaunchPad Program, a 3-stage, outcome-focused initiative designed exclusively for students of
content:
Dear Student of *Charotar University of Science and Technology,*

We are thrilled to introduce the *Career LaunchPad Program*, a 3-stage,
outcome-focused initiative designed exclusively for students of *CHARUSAT*.


Please fill out the *Admission Form*:
Admission form <https://forms.gle/DDjMnNEeBnEXV4pPA>
------------------------------
*Stage 1: Learn (Training)*

   -

   *Skill Training:* Master in-demand skills.
   -

   *Mentorship:* Get guidance from experts:
   ‚ñ´Ô∏è *Ayush Kumar* (Adobe)
   ‚ñ´Ô∏è *Harsh Vajpayee* (Sony India)
   ‚ñ´Ô∏è *Aastha Kanupriya* (Capgemini)
   -

   *Masterclass:* Insights from CXOs of Fortune 500 companies.

*Stage 2: Build (Internship)*

   -

   *Live Projects:* Work on 10+ projects, including a Capstone Project.
   -

   *Real Experience:* Solve real-world problems with startups.

*Stage 3: Launch & Create Your Own Product*

   -

   *Founder Sessions:* Learn MVP Building, Pitching & Scaling.
   -

   *Career Tools:* Resume building, mock interviews, and job opportunities.

------------------------------
*Certification & Program Benefits:*

   -

   *Course Completion Certificate* accredited by *NSDC Skill India*
   -

   *Internship Completion Certificate* verified with a unique *Wipro DICE
   ID* ‚Äî trusted by industry leaders
   -

   Enjoy *6 months of Software Access (LMS)* and *Lifetime Access to Growth
   Community*
   -

   Free *Resume Building Sessions* and *Mock Interview Sessions* to boost
   your confidence and skills
   -

   Get practical experience and tools to launch your career successfully

------------------------------
*Ready to launch your career?*

Please fill out the *Admission Form*:
Admission form <https://forms.gle/DDjMnNEeBnEXV4pPA>
------------------------------

*‚ÄúYour career is your launchpad ‚Äî equip yourself with the right skills,
real experience, and the confidence to soar. This program is your first
step to turning dreams into reality.*

subject: MANDATORY WIPRO SUMMER INTERNSHIP AND AICTE APPROVED INTERNSHIP
snippet: Transform Your Career with Our Exclusive Training & Internship Program! DEAR STUDENT OF CHARUSAT We are excited to announce a unique opportunity in collaboration with NIT Durgapur and Wipro DICE ID
content:
Transform Your Career with Our Exclusive Training & Internship Program!

DEAR STUDENT OF CHARUSAT
We are excited to announce a unique opportunity in collaboration with NIT
Durgapur and Wipro DICE ID, offering a prestigious 2-month Training+
Internship program with certifications from industry giants like CISCO,
META|FACEBOOK, IBM, and various other renowned MNCs in technical and
non-technical domains, with key highlights including placement assistance,
limited seats available, and enhanced career prospects

*Note: If any of your batchmates are missed or haven't received the
notification, recipients are allowed to send this mail to them.*

It is Mandatory for students to submit their application. If you get
shortlisted, you will be getting a call from our HR Team:
*Submit Your Application* <https://forms.gle/k86LWXSJYNX9LQDQ8>
Program Details:Program Overview:

   - *Duration:* 2 months (1 Month of Training + 1 Month of Internship)
   - *Eligibility:* Limited seats available‚Äîensure you apply early to
   secure your place.

Program Structure:*First Month: Expert Training*

   - Live lectures and mentorship from seasoned industry professionals with
   10+ years of experience.
   - Access to online course materials and recorded sessions.
   - *Learning Focus:* In-depth theoretical and practical knowledge in both
   technical and non-technical domains.

*Second Month: Internship*

   - *Internship Projects:*
      - *Project 1:* 10 individual projects for each intern, designed to
      enhance real-world problem-solving skills.
      - *Project 2:* A collaborative Capstone Project, where groups of 15
      interns will work together under mentor guidance.
   - *Mentorship:* Ongoing live mentorship for projects, offering insights
   and practical experience in solving industry-specific challenges.

Class Formats:

*Blended Program:* Access to recorded classes and live doubt clearing
sessions every weekend.

*Mentor-led/Live Classes:* Live Zoom classes at 6:30 PM for 3 to 4days a
week, with recorded sessions available.

*LMS Portal:* Access for 12 months.
Certification:

After completion of the program, students will receive:

   - *Program completion certificate issued by WIPRO*
   - *Co-branded internship certificate from top MNCs.*
   - *100% placement assistance.*
   - *Access to a thriving professional community.*
   - *WIPRO DICE Certification.*

*Submit Your Application* <https://forms.gle/k86LWXSJYNX9LQDQ8>



*Congratulations to students who have already been selected for our
programs:*

subject: EC-Council | Students Upskill with EC-Council Essentials Series
snippet: Dear students, Find the email below for your reference. EC-Council Essentials Series - https://www.eccouncil.org/train-certify/essentials/ ---------- Forwarded message --------- Subject: EC-Council |
content:
Dear students,

Find the email below for your reference.
EC-Council Essentials Series -
https://www.eccouncil.org/train-certify/essentials/

---------- Forwarded message ---------
Subject: EC-Council | Help Your Students Upskill with EC-Council Essentials
To: Priteshkumar Prajapati <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>

Dear Prof Pritesh,

We‚Äôre pleased to offer *CHARUSAT students* a unique opportunity to
access *EC-Council‚Äôs
Essential Series* at a heavily discounted *academia rate of ‚Çπ7,022 per
course*.

These beginner-friendly, globally recognized courses are designed to equip
students with practical cybersecurity skills across a range of key domains:

üìö *Courses Available:*

   1. Network Defense Essentials
   2. Ethical Hacking Essentials
   3. Digital Forensics Essentials
   4. IoT Security Essentials
   5. Threat Intelligence Essentials
   6. Cloud Security Essentials
   7. DevSecOps Essentials
   8. Security Operations Essentials

subject: Invitation to ARTHYANTRA CHARUSAT Tech Team and Content Creation
snippet: Dear CHARUSAT Students, We are excited to announce the upcoming ARTHYANTRA CHARUSAT Tech Team and Content Creation Team Recruitments for 2025. Interested students are required to fill out the Google
content:
Dear CHARUSAT Students,

We are excited to announce the upcoming ARTHYANTRA CHARUSAT Tech
Team and Content Creation Team Recruitments for 2025.

Interested students are required to fill out the Google Form by May 30th
2025. We appreciate your interest and encourage you to participate.

The link to access the form is https://forms.gle/6M3kMDQjVVoEy25y8


For any queries or further information, please contact:
Vansh Malani (9023046891) (President)
Nandini Sherwani(9265737966) (Vice-President)

Best Regards,
Team Arthyantra
(Charusat Economics Club)

subject: Nomenclature Competition I Multi Utility Building @ CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Students, CHARUSAT is excited to invite your creative suggestions for naming our Multi-Utility Complex. The facility is a versatile space for CSIC, CIVF, HRDC, COE, IT Cell, IQAC, conference rooms
content:
Dear Students,

CHARUSAT is excited to invite your creative suggestions for *naming our
Multi-Utility Complex.*
The facility is a versatile space for CSIC, CIVF, HRDC, COE, IT Cell, IQAC,
conference rooms, paperless exam halls, an exam control room, and
multitudes of related services. It is designed to cater to the diverse
needs of CHARUSAT's unique initiatives and will play a pivotal role in
enhancing the overall campus experience.


*Criteria for Nomenclature:*

   - Should reflect Vedic/Sanskrit terminology‚Äîeasily memorable
   - Should be meaningful and relevant to the facility
   - Should have Clarity, brevity, and creativity
   - Should have a touch of academia or knowledge


üéÅPrize: The best fit name will be awarded a cash prize of ‚Çπ11,000/- by the
prime donor of this facility, Shri Devang Patel (Nadiad).


Click to fill out the form <https://forms.gle/WDvwYgL4uC2DBHMi9>
*Deadline*: Submit your response before May 30, 2025.


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

content:

I have attached *Quiz 1*, *Quiz 2*, and a *previous year's regular question
paper* for your reference.

Please also note the following *exam instructions*:

   1.

   A *scientific calculator* is allowed in the exam in MSUD102.

   *Wearing your college ID card is mandatory* during the exam.

*All the best* in your preparation!


*Dr. Bina Patel*

subject: Fwd: Maximize Your Academic Success with CHARUSAT-KRC Subscribed E-Resources for the April-2025 to March- 2026
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Library CHARUSAT <head.lib@charusat.ac.in> Date: Mon, May 12, 2025 at 4:42 PM Subject: Maximize Your Academic Success with CHARUSAT-KRC Subscribed E-
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Library CHARUSAT <head.lib@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, May 12, 2025 at 4:42‚ÄØPM
Subject: Maximize Your Academic Success with CHARUSAT-KRC Subscribed
E-Resources for the April-2025 to March- 2026
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>, Dean CHARUSAT <
dean@charusat.ac.in>, Principal <principal@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

We are pleased to inform you of the extensive range of *electronic
resources* (e-resources) subscribed to by CHARUSAT‚ÄîKnowledge Resource
Centre (KRC), which aim to support and enrich our academic and research
endeavours.

These resources include access to high-quality journals, databases,
e-books, and digital libraries across diverse disciplines. Whether you're
involved in teaching, learning, or research, these resources are invaluable
for staying up-to-date with current developments, accessing peer-reviewed
content, and enhancing the overall quality of academic output.

*Key Benefits:*

¬∑         24/7 access to scholarly content

¬∑         Authoritative sources for assignments and research

¬∑         Support for course design and teaching materials

¬∑         Multidisciplinary coverage for broad academic support

We encourage all faculty members, students, and researchers to make full
use of these resources. Detailed guides, training sessions, and librarian
support are available to help you navigate and utilize the resources
effectively as below:

*Sr. No.*

*Name of the E-resources | Databases*

1

IEEE IEL Online Tier 2

2

Elsevier 4 Subject Collections

*Include:* Pharmacy, Applied Science, Computer Science, Engineering

3

Scopus Indexing Database

4

Taylor & Francis Special Collection

5

The Royal Society of Chemistry (Gold EA)

6

ACM Digital Library

7

APS All Package

8

IOP Science Journal (ESS)

9

Springer 5 Subject Collection of Journals

*Include: *Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, Engineering and Computer Science

10

EBSCO Host - Rehabilitation & Sports Medicine Source

11

EBSCOHOST- Business Source Elite

12

EBSCO CINAHL Plus with full text, EBSCO e-book Nursing Collection, and
EBSCO Nursing Reference Centre Plus

13

J- Gate Social Science & Humanities

14

J- Gate Science & Technology

15

Statista Campus Licence Based Module

*To access the e-resources, please visit:* https://scpit.knimbus.com

Let‚Äôs work together to elevate our teaching and research through informed
use of these academic resources.

Regards,

Dr. Pramod D. Patel
University Librarian
R K Patel Knowledge Resource Centre
CHARUSAT campus,Changa-388421
Mob:- 09879334259
Landline No:02697-265032

subject: IEEE Student Membership Half Yearly Offer
snippet: Dear CHARUSAT Students, We're excited to invite you to join the IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch 2025-26, a platform designed to help you grow both academically and professionally. Whether you're
content:
Dear CHARUSAT Students,

We‚Äôre excited to invite you to join the *IEEE CHARUSAT Student Branch
2025-26*, a platform designed to help you grow both academically and
professionally. Whether you're looking to gain hands-on experience, build
your resume, or expand your network, IEEE has something for you!
What is IEEE?

IEEE is the world‚Äôs largest technical professional organization. Our
Student Branches are university-based groups that offer opportunities for
career development, technical learning, leadership experience, and
networking within fields of engineering and related disciplines.
Why Join the IEEE Student Branch?

   - *Build Your Resume with Projects and Skills:* Participate in technical
   projects, workshops, and hackathons in areas like Robotics, Artificial
   Intelligence, Signal Processing, VLSI, and more.
   - *Exclusive Networking Opportunities:* Connect with industry
   professionals, mentors, and peers globally for internships, jobs, and
   guidance.
   - *Leadership Experience:* Take on roles within the branch to develop
   key professional skills.
   - *Access to Global Competitions and Events:* Join competitions like
   IEEE Xtreme and attend conferences that boost your professional exposure.
   - *Resources to Stay Ahead:* Get access to the IEEE Xplore Digital
   Library and other exclusive member tools.

Learn more about the benefits of IEEE membership:

   - Student Membership Benefits
   <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>
   - General IEEE Membership Benefits
   <https://www.ieee.org/membership/benefits/index.html>

*Avail the half-yearly offer now and join IEEE at a 50% discount!*

Please refer to the attached PDF for step-by-step instructions on how to
take up membership.

For any queries please reply to this mail.

Join IEEE Now <https://students.ieee.org/membership-benefits/>

subject: Fwd: Invitation: Knimbus Off-Campus & M-Library Access Training Programme (Online) ‚Äì May 09, 2025 at 10:30 AM
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Library CHARUSAT <head.lib@charusat.ac.in> Date: Wed, May 7, 2025 at 3:51 PM Subject: Invitation: Knimbus Off-Campus & M-Library Access Training
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Library CHARUSAT <head.lib@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Wed, May 7, 2025 at 3:51‚ÄØPM
Subject: Invitation: Knimbus Off-Campus & M-Library Access Training
Programme (Online) ‚Äì May 09, 2025 at 10:30 AM
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Library Users,

*Knowledge Resource Centre - KRC* organized an online hands-on
training on ‚Äú*Knimbus
off-campus and M-library Access‚Äù*. Through this platform, Users can access
all the library's subscribed resources remotely, which means you can access
them *from* *anywhere, at any time, and on any device.* This is especially
beneficial for natives of CHARUSAT who may need access to e-resources,
online databases, e-books, and other digital resources within the campus
and outside the campus.

Knimbus provides a platform where all subscribed resources are easily
searchable and accessible. This expansion of library services ensures that
learning and research are no longer restricted by physical location,
enhancing the educational experience.

An online knimbus off-campus and m-library Access training programme for
CHARUSAT natives has been organized. Once you register using the link
below, you will get a unique link to join on your email ID. The schedule is
as follows.

*Date*

May 09, 2025

*Time*

10:30 AM

*Title*

Knimbus Off-Campus and M-Library Access training programme

*Trainer *

*Ms. Kanishka Jindal,* Assistant Manager - Training

*Link to Register*

https://meet.zoho.in/dmpv-ecb-ecp

Please join this training programme to learn how to access the e-resources
subscribed by CHARUSAT-KRC and get maximum benefit for your research and
knowledge enhancement.

*Note: *All participants will be awarded an *E-Certificate* of
participation.

--
Regards,

Dr. Pramod D. Patel
University Librarian
R K Patel Knowledge Resource Centre
CHARUSAT campus,Changa-388421
Mob:- 09879334259
Landline No:02697-265032


--

subject: Mechanical ULSC, ILSC and Department Co-Ordinator committee
snippet: Dear Students, Congratulations for being the part of University's most honourable team. Following students are defined for the roles assigned as below. ULSC Student Co-ordinators: (3rd Year) Jayraj
content:
Dear Students,

Congratulations for being the part of University's most honourable team.

Following students are defined for the roles assigned as below.

*ULSC Student Co-ordinators: (3rd Year)*
Jayraj Rathod - 23ME032
Setu Barot - 23ME002

*ILSC Student Co-ordinators: (2nd Year)*
Siddhi Vadhvana - 24ME083
Rudra Parekh - 24ME033

*Sports Co-ordinators: (3rd Year)*
Vinay Moliya - 23ME018
Jinit Lad - 23ME016

*Department Sports Co-ordinators: (2nd Year)*
Heet Shah - 24ME069
Veer Desai - 24ME010

*Roles and Responsibilities:*

1. Sports Co-ordinators:
- Identifying students with an interest in Sports
- Announcements (in-person and social media)
- Gathering records of team formation and participation
- Formation of teams under the supervision of ULSC staff members
- Regular practice sessions & update of sessions to ULSC staff


2. Department Sports Co-ordinators:
- Circulation of information to the students
- Preparation of entries in Spoural and any other sports events in and out
of the campus.
- Record of participation and achievements of Sports events.
- Co-ordination and volunteering for all other department activities.


Note:
All the students who are in ULSC, ILSC or department co-ordinator, remember
that we are a team and we work in coordination and support. All the
decisions and actions should be taken with discussion among the team only.

For any queries or confusion, contact Dr. Punit Patel and me for
clarification.


Looking forward to working with you.

Note
Thanks & regards,

Vikas Panchal

Assistant Professor

Mechanical Engineering | CSPIT, CHARUSAT
8866286233
vikaspanchal.me@charusat.ac.in
CHARUSAT Campus, Changa, Gujarat 388421

subject: Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143
snippet: Thanks for filling out Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Here's what was received. Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143 Syllabus: Experiment 2, 3, and 4 Email * 24me083@charusat.edu.in
content:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143
Here's what was received.


Quiz 1 | Engineering Physics - 2 | PY143

Syllabus: Experiment 2, 3, and 4


Email *


24me083@charusat.edu.in


Name *


Vadhvana siddhi tarunkumar


Student ID No. *


24ME083


Institute - Deparmtment *


CSPIT - ME



Untitled Section


Determine the frequency bandwidth of the circuit? *
Captionless Image


31.8 Hz


32.3 Hz


142 Hz


31.8 kHz


In series LCR circuit, Capacitive reactance (XC) = Inductive reactance (XL)  
then circuit ________ *


is capacitive


is inductive


is at resonance


draws minimum current


In RLC series resonance circuit, on resonance the following condition will  
be fulfilled, *


V=VR


I = I(min)


Z=R


VL=VC


In the "Study of Resonance in LCR circuit" experiment, the range of  
frequency oscillator was fixed to ____________. *


20Hz to 200Hz


200Hz to 2KHz


2KHz to 20KHz


20KHz to 200KHz


One resistor of 1000 ohm and a capacitor of 12 pF is connected in series.  
then what is the value of time constant. (pF is picoFarade) *


12 ns (n is nano)


1.2 s


12 fs (f is femto)


none


In series RC ckt, a major part of transient is due to resistor only. *


True


false


The time constant of RC ckt becomes __________ with larger value of  
resistor and capacitor *


Larger


shorter


won't change


None of the aboce


The magnitude of energy stored in a capacitor is given by a formula; E =  
(1/2) (C*V^2) *


True


False


In the "Transient Analysis of RC Ckt" experiment, discharing of capacitor's  
voltage has been measured with respect to ____ *


Current


Time


Resistor


None


Which apparatus is not used in the experiment to measure the variation in  
the magnetic field? *


Battery Eliminator


Coil


Reversible Key


Volt meter


Magnetic fields are produced due to __________ *


Stationary charges


Moving charges


Both a and b


None of the above


One coil of radius of R1 is able to produces the magnetic field of B at the  
center of the coil, if radius of the coil is doubled then what will be the  
value of magnetic field. *


0.5 B


4 B


0.25 B


B


The magnetic field density along the axial line of a circular coil carrying  
current is/does *


Zero


Constant


Vary with distance from the center of the coil


not change


Strength of an electromagnet can be increased by *


increasing the number of turns


increasing the cross-sectional area


increasing current supply


all above methods


Resonant circuits are used in tuning of


A radio


A TV set


Both a and b


CD player


Create your own Google Form

subject: 50 Mark of Continuous Evaluation process(CEP) MSUD102
snippet: Dear Students, Good morning. Please note that I have attached a PDF file containing the 50 Marks CEP calculation for MSUD102 with this email. If you have any questions about the mark entry, please let
content:
Dear Students,
Good morning.

Please note that I have attached a PDF file containing the 50 Marks CEP
calculation for MSUD102 with this email.

If you have any questions about the mark entry, please let me know on or
before *09:00 AM, 05/05/2025*. I will forward the marks to the examination
section *after 10:00 AM on 05/05/2025*, and no queries will be entertained
after that.
*Thanks and regards,*
*Rajesh V. Savalia *
*PhD, MPhil*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences*
*P. D. Patel Institute of Applied **Sciences*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology*
*Accredited Grade 'A+' by NAAC *
*Website: https://www.charusat.ac.in/ <https://www.charusat.ac.in/>*
*M. No. 94292 22899*

--

<https://go.cloudplatformonline.com/dc/j-0ZLuKiroz5jBuK2yHK5CJ6ILCpYkKSM2bjwsh0ZRMQWGeonCIIqpEhYE0ycwQp5zliZX7ciSPAjlpccRbKFqvx5lx-Jyj_SUG898ZDn477QCReC6HR4r3n13FDkUkBuVBY1NouHkxwjjD3Z11ExZi4XAg2R5ylNZo1sYxqU0BISMFjoMyNmFbCHqs4pV3KL5G9jKpk9DHcMjxeZbEvB4GZEiKCupnZ64lI0qVNif3NjQuidsj0p5raJ14UR3pQLLi0e0PqYZJjRAvjef8Lm3x-5Qg-T6MitLrLnYBeCWh4HBifAo-rPyA2-Aak5cG7/ODA4LUdKVy0zMTQAAAGaKUvWtr6AASl06eicAURpSlDiyESFNOO01MWKQNcz8ob0uCysvXvBsj0UTstrZr3yVX0jnZI=>

Hi Dr. Priteshkumar,

Amidst the hype surrounding AI-driven cyber threats, what's actually
happening in the wild?

In our upcoming webinar, Adversarial misuse of generative AI: Analysis
beyond the hype
<https://go.cloudplatformonline.com/dc/j-0ZLuKiroz5jBuK2yHK5CJ6ILCpYkKSM2bjwsh0ZRMQWGeonCIIqpEhYE0ycwQp5zliZX7ciSPAjlpccRbKFqvx5lx-Jyj_SUG898ZDn477QCReC6HR4r3n13FDkUkBuVBY1NouHkxwjjD3Z11ExZi4XAg2R5ylNZo1sYxqU0BISMFjoMyNmFbCHqs4pV3KL5G9jKpk9DHcMjxeZbEvB4GZEiKCupnZ64lI0qVNif3NjQuidsj0p5raJ14UR3pQLLi0e0PqYZJjRAvjef8Lm3x-5Qg-T6MitLrLnYBeCWh4HBifAo-rPyA2-Aak5cG7/ODA4LUdKVy0zMTQAAAGaKUvWtr6AASl06eicAURpSlDiyESFNOO01MWKQNcz8ob0uCysvXvBsj0UTstrZr3yVX0jnZI=>,
Google Threat Intelligence experts move beyond theoretical discussions of
abuse of AI, drawing on real-world observations of how government-backed
threat actors have attempted to misuse Google‚Äôs AI-powered assistant Gemini
for cyber attacks and information operations.

Our goal is to shed light on these activities with security professionals
to raise awareness and enable stronger protections for all.

*Topics covered include:*

   - Specific cases of attempted misuse of Gemini by nation-state threat
   actors.
   - How AI is being leveraged across various stages of cyberattacks, from
   initial reconnaissance to post-compromise activities.
   - In-depth analysis of government-backed threat activity and if it
   represents novel or unique AI-enabled attack or abuse techniques.

Speakers

Jamie Collier

Lead Threat Intelligence Advisor (Europe), Google Threat Intelligence Group
[image: Aurora Blum]

Aurora Blum

Threat Intel Analyst, Google Threat Intelligence Group
[image: Bart Inglot]

Bart Inglot

Security Engineer, Google Threat Intelligence Group

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to stay ahead of the curve in understanding
AI-driven cyber threats.
Register now
<https://go.cloudplatformonline.com/dc/j-0ZLuKiroz5jBuK2yHK5CJ6ILCpYkKSM2bjwsh0ZRMQWGeonCIIqpEhYE0ycwQp5zliZX7ciSPAjlpccRbKFqvx5lx-Jyj_SUG898ZDn477QCReC6HR4r3n13FDkUkBuVBY1NouHkxwjjD3Z11ExZi4XAg2R5ylNZo1sYxqU0BISMFjoMyNmFbCHqs4pV3KL5G9jKpk9DHcMjxeZbEvB4GZEiKCupnZ64lI0qVNif3NjQuidsj0p5raJ14UR3pQLLi0e0PqYZJjRAvjef8Lm3x-5Qg-T6MitLrLnYBeCWh4HBifAo-rPyA2-Aak5cG7/ODA4LUdKVy0zMTQAAAGaKUvWtr6AASl06eicAURpSlDiyESFNOO01MWKQNcz8ob0uCysvXvBsj0UTstrZr3yVX0jnZI=>

subject: Join ‚ÄúFrench For All‚Äù ‚Äì 30-Hour Offline French Language Training at CHARUSAT
snippet: Dear Students, Looking to add an exciting and valuable skill to your profile? The Faculty of Humanities (FoH), CHARUSAT is offering a 30-hour offline interactive training program titled ‚ÄúFrench For All
content:
Dear Students,

Looking to add an exciting and valuable skill to your profile?

The *Faculty of Humanities (FoH), CHARUSAT* is offering a *30-hour offline
interactive training program* titled *‚ÄúFrench For All‚Äù*, from *12th May to
30th May, 2025‚Äî* specially designed for *beginners and language enthusiasts*
.

In today‚Äôs global job market, just having technical or academic skills is
no longer enough. *Learning a foreign language like French can give you a
competitive edge*, opening up new career opportunities, international
exposure, and cultural insights.

This is your chance to:

‚úîÔ∏è ‚Å£Explore the beauty and power of the French language
‚úîÔ∏è Gain a strong foundation in Listening, Speaking, Reading, and Writing
(LSRW)
‚úîÔ∏è Learn in a fun, engaging classroom environment

 *The detailed brochure is attached for your reference.*
üìû For queries, contact *Dr. Vikas Raval* at +91 94293 56638

Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to enhance your future ‚Äî *enroll now and say
‚ÄúBonjour‚Äù to new possibilities!*


Best wishes,
Faculty of Humanities
CHARUSAT


*Kruten Patel*
*Executive Officer (Corporate Communications)*

content:
Dear Students
If any of the students want to submit the assignment, then they can consult
me in the PDPIAS Room 102. *Pls do not put your book on My desk.*

In AIML, I will take the submission in my lecture at 03:20.
Pls share the information in whatsapp grp.

subject: Quiz Link and Important Instructions
snippet: Dear Students, This is the quiz link. Please read the following instructions carefully: Quiz duration is 10 minutes: from 11:20 AM to 11:30 AM. Write your ID number, not your name. If you face any
content:
Dear Students,

This is the quiz link. Please read the following instructions carefully:

   -

   Quiz duration is 10 minutes: from 11:20 AM to 11:30 AM.
   -

   Write your* ID number,* *not your name.*
   -

   If you face any submission issues, please take a* screenshot *
   immediately.
   -

   Ensure you are connected to a good network.
   -

   The time limit will be strictly followed. No submissions will be
   accepted after 11:30 AM.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdbjbf8UNpXQG95zvFgpflxAXPvBbjM9chqP71JHX6UQ2kfSA/viewform?usp=header

subject: Journal + Lab Manual Submission, Notification for Quiz 2
snippet: Dear Students, You must certify your lab manual + Journal with the respective lab-in-charge on/before 2nd May 2025. After this date, no journals will be certified, and you will not be allowed to take
content:
Dear Students,

You must certify your lab manual + Journal with the respective
lab-in-charge on/before 2nd May 2025. After this date, no journals will be
certified, and you will not be allowed to take the practical examinations.

Quiz 2 (of 15 Marks) will be arranged on the 3rd of May 2025, which covers
the questions of Experiments 2, 3, and 4. The timing of the quiz will be
4:30 PM to 5:00 PM, the link will be sent 5 minutes before the exam.

Regards
Sanni

-- 
*Thanks,*



*Sanni, Ph.D.Assistant professorDepartment of Physical Sciences
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/PDPIAS/people/>Faculty of Applied SciencesP D
Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,CHARUSAT
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/>, Changa. - 388 421, India*

subject: MCQ - Based Quiz - MEUC102 on 01/05/2025 @ 8:00 pm
snippet: Dear Students, Please find the details of the MCQ-based Quiz for MEUC102- Basics of Civil & Mechanical Engineering. Exam type : MCQ-based Quiz Date & day: 01/05/2025, Thursday Platform : Google
content:
Dear Students,

Please find the details of the MCQ-based Quiz for MEUC102- Basics of Civil
& Mechanical Engineering.

Exam type : MCQ-based Quiz

Date & day: 01/05/2025, Thursday

Platform : Google Classroom

Marks : 30 Marks

Time : 8:00 pm - 8:30 pm

Topics : IC Engines, Pumps & Compressors, Refrigeration, Scope of Civil
Engineering, Introduction to Surveying, Elements of building construction

Please save your responses before time, *it won't submit automatically*.
The exam form will close accepting responses exactly at 8:30 pm. No
requests will be entertained after the stipulated time.

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

Assistant Professor

Charotar University of Science & Technology

+91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in

snippet: Dear Students, This is to inform you that due to technical reasons, all user passwords on the Skill Augmentation Portal (https://skill-augmentation.com/) have been reset. We request you to please try
content:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you that due to technical reasons, all user passwords on
the *Skill Augmentation Portal* (*https://skill-augmentation.com/
<https://skill-augmentation.com/>*) have been reset.

We request you to please *try logging in using your old password first*.
If you receive an *"Invalid credentials"* message, kindly click on the *"Forgot
Password"* link and reset your password.

üîó *Login here:* https://skill-augmentation.com/

Your prompt action is appreciated. If you continue to face any issues
during login, feel free to reach out for assistance.

Thank you for your cooperation.

subject: EC-Council | Hackerverse Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge - Invites Students for Monthly Cyber-competitions
snippet: Dear students, EC-Council has launched Hackerverse Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge. Find the details below and register using your CHARUSAT email id for the same. Hackerverse is a global cybersecurity
content:
Dear students,

*EC-Council has launched Hackerverse **Capture the Flag (CTF) challenge**.
Find the details below and register using your CHARUSAT email id for the
same.*

Hackerverse is a global cybersecurity competition ecosystem designed by
EC-Council to support and advance the cybersecurity community worldwide.
Rooted in EC-Council‚Äôs longstanding commitment to empowering cybersecurity
professionals worldwide, Hackerverse provides a competitive arena for
individuals across all proficiency levels to demonstrate their skills
through rigorous, gamified *Capture the Flag (CTF) challenges*.

Hackerverse was officially unveiled at Hacker Halted 2022, EC-Council‚Äôs
annual cybersecurity conference that unites ethical hackers, security
professionals, and industry leaders from across the globe. A platform for
thought leadership and technical exchange, Hacker Halted serves as a
convergence point for innovation, research, and discourse on emerging cyber
threats and defense strategies.

Hackerverse has helped EC-Council to broaden its impact, transitioning from
localized cybersecurity competitions to a truly global competitive
platform. *Through Hackerverse CTF, a year-long, free-to-enter Capture the
Flag (CTF) challenge on Hackerverse, cybersecurity professionals and
enthusiasts from around the world can now test their skills on a much
larger stage. *The competition features a dynamic scoring system that
rewards participants for speed and precision, reflecting the high-stakes
nature of cybersecurity. *With over $100,000 in prizes, it represents
EC-Council‚Äôs commitment to supporting and rewarding cybersecurity talent
worldwide.*

As cyber threats continue to evolve, Hackerverse remains a dynamic proving
ground, ensuring that the next generation of cybersecurity professionals is
prepared to meet the challenges of an increasingly complex digital
landscape.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
Subject: EC-Council | Invites Students for Monthly Cybercompetitions
To: priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in <priteshprajapati.it@charusat.ac.in>


*What is the Hackerverse?*

‚ÄúThe Hackerverse‚Äù (hacker universe) is an environment consisting of
gamified cybersecurity knowledge and skills-based competitions designed to
support individuals, whether they are aspiring, new, or seasoned
professionals in the cybersecurity field.

[image: A screenshot of a video game AI-generated content may be incorrect.]

*The Hackerverse CTF*

The Hackerverse CTF is a free, global Capture the Flag competition offering
monthly rotating challenges across the latest topics and skills valued by
industry and employers. Participants may compete monthly for cash and
in-kind prizes awarded to players achieving top scores on the leaderboard.

[image: A diagram of a business strategy AI-generated content may be
incorrect.]

*Who Can Register?*

The Hackerverse CTF is open to players ages 14 and up. Any student or
professional who wishes to participate may do so.

[image: A blurry image of a computer AI-generated content may be incorrect.]

*Grow and Validate Your Cybersecurity Skills*

Participants within the Hackerverse CTF will be able to showcase their
skills and talent, completing a series of carefully designed questions that
get progressively more difficult. Players will compete against a global
network for prizes and top rankings. The primary focus of the Hackerverse
CTF is to get more participants engaged in cybersecurity competitions,
leading to increased knowledge and skill development.

<https://hackerverse.com/>

[image: A red background with white text and white text AI-generated
content may be incorrect.]

*Your Cybersecurity Skill Development Starts Now!*

Registration for the Hackerverse CTF is currently open. To find out more
about the Hackerverse cybersecurity competitions and engagements, please
visit www.hackerverse.com.

<https://hackerverse.com/>

New assignment

Assignment-2
Q.1. Explain the key differences between  and  in Python. When would you  
prefer using a tuple over a list?
Q.2. Why does a set not allow duplicate elements? How does Python enforce  
this behavior?
Q.3. How does a set differ from a frozen set?
Q.4. Between lists, tuples, and sets, which is the most memory-efficient  
for storing large sequences of data? Justify your answer.
Q.5. What are the four pillars of OOP?
Q.6. Explain the difference between a class and an object.
Q.7. What is self in Python?
Q.8. What is method overriding? Give an example.
Q.9. What is the purpose of super()?
