subject: Seating Arrangement - FTE: B.Tech-II External Exam Starting from 17th May, 2025
snippet: Dear students, Please find the Seating Arrangement - FTE: B.Tech-II External Exam Starting from 17th May, 2025. You are required to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the email attachment.
content:
*Dear students,*


Please find the Seating Arrangement - FTE: B.Tech-II External Exam Starting
from 17th May, 2025.



   - You are required to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the
   email attachment.
   - You are required to uphold decorum in the examination hall. Mobile
   phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic devices are strictly
   prohibited within the exam hall.
   - Bags must be left outside, and it is mandatory to wear an ID card.
   - You have to take your seat in the exam hall at least 15 minutes prior
   to the exam time.


*Exam centre:  Exam Hall 201 (1st floor)  and Exam Hall 301 (2nd floor) of
Multi Utility Complex.*


In order to maintain discipline, the following rules will be strictly
enforced ..

1.      *Late Entry Not Allowed*:
Student must occupy their seats *at least 15 minutes before* the start of
the examination.
*The exam hall gates will be closed 10 minutes prior* to the scheduled exam
time. Latecomers will *not be allowed* to enter or attempt the exam under
any circumstances.

2.      *Misuse of ID Cards ‚Äì Strict Action*:
If any student is found engaging in *malpractice*, such as using someone
else‚Äôs ID card then it will be considered as a UFM case and *strict
disciplinary action will be taken*. This may include *cancellation of
admission* from the university.
In case a student does *not have their ID card* for any valid reason, they
must obtain *prior written permission* from their *HOD or the Principal*.

3.      *Mobile Phone & Study Material in Bag-Drop Zone*:
Students have been found *using mobile phones and reading notes* in
the *bag-drop
zone*.
All mobile phones, smart watches, head/ear phones, electronic devices and
study material must be *kept in bags before entering through the main gate
(ground floor)*.

4.      *Unpaid Fees ‚Äì Not allowed in Exam*:
Some students have still not paid their fees. *Such students will not be
allowed to appear for the exams from tomorrow onwards.* Please ensure all
dues are cleared immediately.

*So strictly follow the above rules to avoid any disciplinary action.*


-- 
with regards:

*Dr. Dattatraya G. Subhedar*
Associate Professor,
Department of Mechanical Engineering,
Faculty of Technology & Engineering
Charotar University of Science & Technology

*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC*

*Accredited with "Grade A" by KCG*
Education Campus Changa -388421
Dist: Anand, Gujarat India

Phone Contact:
Mobile: 09712624320
(O): 02697 265227
Fax: 02697 247100

--

subject: Fwd: Regarding Poster Presentation for BCME (MEUC102) on 19th April, 2025, Saturday
snippet: Dear Students, Please follow the schedule given below for the poster presentation event on 19/04/2025, Saturday. Stream Sr. No. (as per attachment) Timings Venue Mechanical Engineering 1-22 9:30 - 11:
content:
Dear Students,

Please follow the schedule given below for the poster presentation event on
19/04/2025, Saturday.

Stream

Sr. No. (as per attachment)

Timings

Venue

Mechanical Engineering

1-22

9:30 - 11:00 am

 Drawing Hall 628A

23-44

9:30 - 11:00 am

Drawing Hall 627B

Civil Engineering

45-68

11:00- 12:30 pm

Drawing Hall 627B

Electrical Engineering

69-100

11:00- 12:30 pm

Drawing Hall 628A

Bring Thumb pins or clamping pins to secure your poster on the drawing
table.

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

Assistant Professor

Charotar University of Science & Technology

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar <abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Apr 7, 2025 at 3:00‚ÄØPM
Subject: Fwd: Regarding Poster Presentation for BCME (MEUC102) on 19th
April, 2025, Saturday
To: <24me@charusat.edu.in>, <24ee@charusat.edu.in>, <24cl@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Pinal Patel <pinalpatel.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Megha Desai <
meghadesai.cv@charusat.ac.in>, GAURANG PATEL <gaurangpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>,
Harmish Bhatt <harmishbhatt.me@charusat.ac.in>, Bhargav Shobhana <
bhargavshobhana.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Bhavin Mehta <
bhavinmehta.me@charusat.ac.in>, Head Electrical CHARUSAT <
hod.ee@charusat.ac.in>, Head Civil CHARUSAT <hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Dr.
Vijay Chaudhary <vijaychaudhary.me@charusat.ac.in>, Principal C.S.Patel
Institute of Technology <principal.cspit@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Regarding the trailing mail, please find the list of topics allotted
group-wise.
Follow all the instructions as per the trailing mail and the attached file.

The presentations will be on *19 April 2025, Saturday*. So all of you are
requested to plan accordingly.

In case of any queries regarding topic content, please contact your faculty
member.

Thank you.

Best Regards,




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar <abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Mar 27, 2025 at 4:50‚ÄØPM
Subject: Regarding Poster Presentation for BCME (MEUC102) on 19th April,
2025, Saturday
To: <24me@charusat.edu.in>, <24ee@charusat.edu.in>, <24cl@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Bhavin Mehta <bhavinmehta.me@charusat.ac.in>, Pinal Patel <
pinalpatel.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Bhargav Shobhana <
bhargavshobhana.cv@charusat.ac.in>, GAURANG PATEL <
gaurangpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>, Harmish Bhatt <
harmishbhatt.me@charusat.ac.in>, Megha Desai <meghadesai.cv@charusat.ac.in>,
Dr. Vijay Chaudhary <vijaychaudhary.me@charusat.ac.in>, Head Civil CHARUSAT
<hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Head Electrical CHARUSAT <hod.ee@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Hope this mail finds you well.

CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering is going to
organize the Poster presentation (MEUC102) for all first-year Mechanical,
Civil and Electrical Engineering students on *19th April, 2025, Saturday*.

Please keep the following points in mind:

   1. The topic will be informed to you by next week. The topic, once
   fixed, will not be changed later.
   2. The weightage will be 10 marks as lab component.
   3. The size of the poster will be *A2 size*. The sample format is
   attached here for your reference. Don't change the size of the poster
   sample. You only need to insert the images and the text related to your
   topic, convert to PDF and take print on A2 size.
   4. Please convey your group (*max 2 in one group*) to your class CR [
   Vishwesh (24ME057) in Mechanical, Dhyey (24CL008) in Civil+ME, Priyansh
   (24EE004) in Electrical]
   5. Any other point, if needed, will be shared with you later.


Thank you.

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

Assistant Professor

Charotar University of Science & Technology

+91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in

CHARUSAT shared a post: CHARUSAT joins hands with LMExams ‚Äì LittleMore Innovation Labs to drive a bold shift toward paperless, tech-powered examinations across India.

Through this strategic MoU:
- CHARUSAT will assemble Digital 10P tablets.
- Provide device support and operational assistance.
- Enable seamless, paperless exams across Gujarat and beyond.
- Support universities in adopting digital, eco-friendly systems.
- Help reduce the environmental footprint of exam processes.
- Promote a sustainable and technology-driven education ecosystem.

Together, we‚Äôre setting a new benchmark for smart, scalable, and future-ready education.

subject: Class Rescheduling and Upcoming Class Test (Friday)
snippet: Dear Students, Please note that our lecture (CL +ME) scheduled for today from 1:10 PM to 2:10 PM has been rescheduled to Friday from 2:20 PM to 3:20 PM. Additionally, during the Friday lecture, we will
content:
Dear Students,

Please note that our lecture *(CL +ME) * scheduled for *today from 1:10 PM
to 2:10 PM* has been *rescheduled to Friday from 2:20 PM to 3:20 PM*.

Additionally, during the Friday lecture, we will conduct a *Class Test for
10 marks* based on the following syllabus:
------------------------------

*Unit 2:*

   -

   Methods for finding particular integrals: Variation of Parameters and
   Undetermined Coefficients
   -

   Linear Differential Equations of Higher Order with Variable
   Coefficients: Legendre‚Äôs Equation (Special Case: Cauchy‚ÄìEuler Equation)

*Unit 5:*

   -

   Introduction to Improper Integrals
   -

   Definitions and Properties of Gamma, Beta, and Error Functions
   -

   Transformation to Polar Coordinates
   -

   Applications of Double Integrals: Area
   -

   Evaluation of Triple Integrals
   -


*Examination Pattern:*

   -

   *Question 1:* 3 Short Questions ‚Äì 2 Marks Each
   -

   *Question 2:* 2 Short Questions ‚Äì 3 Marks Each

Please be prepared accordingly.


 *This email is for students who are in the combined CL + Mechanical class,
not for those in a separate ME class *

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *
*‡§µ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ß‡•à‡§µ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ü‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ï‡§Æ*

subject: Rescheduling of Quiz to 28th April
snippet: Dear Students, Due to an unexpected official engagement, our online quiz (MSUD102) has been postponed and will now be rescheduled to 28th April, from 11:20 AM to 11:30 AM. Please note that the syllabus
content:
Dear Students,

Due to an unexpected official engagement, our online quiz (MSUD102) has
been postponed and will now be rescheduled to *28th April*, from *11:20 AM
to 11:30 AM.*

Please note that the *syllabus remains the same as discussed earlier*.

Thank you for your understanding.

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *

subject: Class test of MSUD102 (ME div I only)
snippet: Dear Students of ME div I Kindly note that the class test of MSUD102 is scheduled as follows Date: 18/4/2025 Time : 10:10 to 11:10 Syllabus : Unit 2(Whole unit) and Unit 3 Formation of PDE Unit 4 :
content:
Dear Students of ME div I
Kindly note that the class test of MSUD102 is scheduled as follows
Date: 18/4/2025
Time : 10:10 to 11:10
Syllabus : Unit 2(Whole unit) and Unit 3 Formation of PDE
                 Unit 4 : Double integral
Marks: 10 marks
*You are all informed to remain present, and retest will not be taken under
any circumstances. *

*Thanks and regards,*
*Rajesh V. Savalia *
*PhD, MPhil*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences*
*P. D. Patel Institute of Applied **Sciences*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology*
*Accredited Grade 'A+' by NAAC *
*Website: https://www.charusat.ac.in/ <https://www.charusat.ac.in/>*
*M. No. 94292 22899*

Dear Students
The marks of arrear quiz of those students who were absent in Regular quiz
exam are as follows::
24AIML003 3
24AIML008 4
24AIML031 2
24AIML038 2
24AIML067 2

subject: INFO!! CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY NOTICE "APPLY FOR IIT COLLABORATED INTERNSHIP"
snippet: ( 1st yr ) [ IMPORTANT] Salutations! Launch ED in collaboration with IIT KHARAGPUR KSHITIJ and are organizing a 2 Months Training + Internship program with certifications from CISCO, META & various
content:
*( 1st yr )*
*[ IMPORTANT]*



*Salutations!*

*Launch ED *in collaboration with *IIT KHARAGPUR  KSHITIJ *and are
organizing a 2 Months Training + Internship program with certifications
from *CISCO, META* & various other MNCs' s in technical and non-technical
domains. We are enrolling *SHORTLISTED STUDENTS *in the program for
Charusat UNIVERSITY

*Note: If any of your batchmates are missed or haven't received
the notification, recipients are allowed to send this mail to them.*
*LAST 9 SCHOLARSHIP SEAT ARE LEFT*
https://forms.gle/EqAvdBZn1TbB8GJu9

*Students must submit their application. After getting shortlisted, you
will be getting a response from our HR Team:*




*FIND THE BELOW ATTACHMENTS FOR REFERENCE:*
First month: IIT training has been designed in the form of Live lectures
along with live mentorship from industry professionals. (Login credentials
will be provided to students after registration)

Second month: Internship with live mentorship for projects from
professionals. The LIVE INDUSTRY PROJECT will give students experience in
solving real-world problems.

Project 1:- 10 individual projects assigned to each intern which they have
to complete with their mentor.

Project 2:-  Capstone Project: It's a group project assigned to a group of
15 interns. For each intern particular work will be assigned to them they
have to work on it.
(Essential data and materials required for the project will be provided by
the company side itself)

Two types of Classes, we are providing:

1. Blended Program/Recorded classes: You will receive recorded sessions,
whatever doubts you have you can clear it in live doubt-clearing sessions
which will be organized every weekend.

2. Mentor-led/Live classes: You will be having live Zoom classes at 6:30
PM  for 2 to 3 days a week. You will receive your recorded sessions as well
LMS(Learning Management System) portal which you will have admittance to
for 6 months.


*After Completion of the program, the student shall receive a:*
[image: ‚úÖ] *Program completion certificate* issued by IIT KHARAGPUR KSHITIZ.
[image: ‚úÖ] *Certificates verified* through *Wipro* Dice ID.
[image: ‚úÖ] Co-Branded *Internship certificate from Top MNCs.*
[image: ‚úÖ] *100 percent Placement Assistance.*
[image: ‚úÖ] Admittance to a *growing community*.
[image: ‚úÖ] Program Offering with *Low-Code and No-Code Tools. *
[image: ‚úÖ] *100 percent Outcome Driven Result.*
[image: ‚úÖ] The curriculum includes *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering.*
[image: ‚úÖ] *Exclusive Masterclasses* with *Founders and CXOs of Top Global
Companies.*
[image: ‚úÖ] *Personalized Instructors* for proper guidance.




*[THIS NOTIFICATION FOR THE ENROLLMENT OF   MAY-JUNE, JUNE-JULY, JULY-AUG
BATCHES FOR STUDENTS WHO HAVEN'T BEEN ABLE TO ACCEPT THE SCHOLARSHIP SLOT
FOR THE SAME.*

subject: Fwd: Circulation of Energy Conservation Policy ‚Äì Request for Implementation and Compliance
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in> Date: Thu, Apr 10, 2025 at 4:25 PM Subject: Circulation of Energy Conservation Policy ‚Äì Request for
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Registrar CHARUSAT <registrar@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Apr 10, 2025 at 4:25‚ÄØPM
Subject: Circulation of Energy Conservation Policy ‚Äì Request for
Implementation and Compliance
To: Charusat Family <charusatfamily@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

In alignment with our ongoing commitment to sustainable development and
environmental care, CHARUSAT has formally adopted the *Energy Conservation
Policy* as a part of our broader environmental initiatives.

This policy is designed to promote responsible energy use, reduce carbon
emissions, and foster a culture of energy efficiency across the campus.

*Key objectives of the Energy Conservation Policy include:*
    1. Encourage reduction in electricity consumption through efficient
practices.
    2. Promote the use of energy-efficient appliances and technologies.
    3. Optimize energy usage in laboratories, classrooms, and
administrative areas.
    4. Support awareness programs and campaigns on energy conservation.
    5. Monitor and evaluate energy usage to identify areas for improvement.


All departments/institutes are kindly requested to:

   -     Disseminate the contents of the Energy Conservation Policy among
   staff and students.
   -     Sensitize their respective communities about the importance of
   energy efficiency.
   -     Implement measures in line with the policy to ensure effective
   energy management.



The Energy Conservation Policy document is attached herewith.

Let us collectively contribute to building a more energy-efficient and
environmentally responsible campus at CHARUSAT.

Thank you for your cooperation.
Regards
*Dr. Atul Patel*

*Registrar*





Accredited Grade ‚ÄúA+‚Äù by NAAC


www.charusat.ac.in


-- 
with regards:

*Dr. Dattatraya G. Subhedar*
Associate Professor,
Department of Mechanical Engineering,
Faculty of Technology & Engineering
Charotar University of Science & Technology

*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC*

*Accredited with "Grade A" by KCG*
Education Campus Changa -388421
Dist: Anand, Gujarat India

(O): 02697 265227
Fax: 02697 247100

content:
Dear Students,


It has been observed that a number of students are missing the Mathematics
practice sessions. Please note that attendance in these sessions is
mandatory, *and absence may directly impact your marks.*

We strongly urge you to take these sessions seriously and ensure your
regular participation. These classes are designed to strengthen your
understanding and improve your performance.


Regards,

*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*

subject: Strict Instructions for Second Online Quiz MSUD102 ‚Äì 19th April at 11:00 AM
snippet: Dear Students, This is to inform you that the second online quiz (5 Marks) is scheduled on 19th April at 11:00 AM sharp. Please note the following strict instructions: No further quiz will be conducted
content:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you that the *second online quiz (5 Marks)* is scheduled
on *19th April at 11:00 AM sharp*.

Please note the following *strict instructions*:

   1.

   *No further quiz* will be conducted *either online or offline* under any
   circumstances.
   2.

   Ensure you are in an area with *proper internet connectivity*.
   3.

   *Avoid travelling* during the quiz time.
   4.

   The *quiz duration is exactly 10 minutes*.
   5.

   In case of any *technical error or issue from your side*, the quiz *will
   not be reopened or resubmitted*.

Make sure to take this seriously and be fully prepared in advance.

Regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *

subject: üöÄ Final Call: Last Day to Register for Summer 2025 Internship with NSDC Certification
snippet: Dear Students of Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) Congratulations on being shortlisted for our National Skill Development Certified Internship Program, verified by Wipro Dice ID
content:
Dear Students of *Charotar University of Science and Technology* (*CHARUSAT*
)

Congratulations on being shortlisted for our *National Skill Development
Certified* Internship Program, verified by *Wipro Dice ID*!

üî¥ *‚è≥ Registration Closes Today at 7:45 PM | 8th April 2025*

üîó *Apply Now:* *https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A*
<https://forms.gle/4ztjoYsdkezu32F5A>

üìå *Referral ID:* *CHA_25* (Exclusive for* CHARUSAT *Students)

This opportunity is available for every department with fixed slots from
*CHARUSAT* to participate in a 2-Month Summer Training + Internship Program
with *WIPRO DICE ID* Certifications!
------------------------------
üí° *Program Overview:*

‚úÖ *Month 1:* Live training sessions led by industry experts

‚úÖ *Month 2:* Internship with real-world projects & expert mentorship

‚úÖ *24/7 Support:* Dedicated mentorship, doubt-clearing sessions, and career
guidance

üéØ This program is designed to help you build a strong foundation and gain
real-world experience to stand out in the competitive job market.

------------------------------
üéì *Certifications & Credentials:*

üèÜ *Certificate of Completion* (Recognized by WIPRO DICE ID & Leading MNCs)

üèÜ *Internship Certificate* validating hands-on experience

üèÜ *Letter of Recommendation* for top-performing students

üìå Boost your career profile with globally recognized certifications that
enhance your employability!
------------------------------
üìà *Additional Benefits:*

‚ú® *6-month LMS access* for continuous learning

‚ú® *Placement assistance* through our dedicated career network

‚ú® *Mock interviews & resume-building support* to boost your job prospects

üíº Get a step closer to your dream job with expert career guidance and
placement assistance!
------------------------------

üéØ *INTERNSHIP WITH NSDC CERTIFICATION!*

üëâ We are excited to announce that all students attending this exclusive
2-Month Summer *Training + Internship* Program will now receive an
*NSDC* (National
Skill Development Corporation)  and *WIPRO DICE ID* Certification ‚Äì a
valuable credential that can be used for placement and college purposes.

üèÜ *NSDC* *Certification* ‚Äì Students will now receive an *NSDC* (National
Skill Development Corporation) Certification upon completion, which can be
used for placement and college purposes.
------------------------------

üö® *Final Reminder:*

 This is your *last chance to secure your spot*! All student details will
be submitted to the registration department by *EOD Today*. *Don‚Äôt miss out
on this career-defining opportunity!*

‚ö†Ô∏è *If you have already registered, kindly ignore this email.*

For any queries, feel free to reply to this email.

*Best Regards,*
*Rutwik Gaikwad*
*Senior Executive*
*LaunchEd Global*

subject: Fwd: Regarding Poster Presentation for BCME (MEUC102) on 19th April, 2025, Saturday
snippet: Dear Students, Regarding the trailing mail, please find the list of topics allotted group-wise. Follow all the instructions as per the trailing mail and the attached file. The presentations will be on
content:
Dear Students,

Regarding the trailing mail, please find the list of topics allotted
group-wise.
Follow all the instructions as per the trailing mail and the attached file.

The presentations will be on *19 April 2025, Saturday*. So all of you are
requested to plan accordingly.

In case of any queries regarding topic content, please contact your faculty
member.

Thank you.

Best Regards,




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar <abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Mar 27, 2025 at 4:50‚ÄØPM
Subject: Regarding Poster Presentation for BCME (MEUC102) on 19th April,
2025, Saturday
To: <24me@charusat.edu.in>, <24ee@charusat.edu.in>, <24cl@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Bhavin Mehta <bhavinmehta.me@charusat.ac.in>, Pinal Patel <
pinalpatel.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Bhargav Shobhana <
bhargavshobhana.cv@charusat.ac.in>, GAURANG PATEL <
gaurangpatel.me@charusat.ac.in>, Harmish Bhatt <
harmishbhatt.me@charusat.ac.in>, Megha Desai <meghadesai.cv@charusat.ac.in>,
Dr. Vijay Chaudhary <vijaychaudhary.me@charusat.ac.in>, Head Civil CHARUSAT
<hod.cv@charusat.ac.in>, Head Electrical CHARUSAT <hod.ee@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

Hope this mail finds you well.

CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering is going to
organize the Poster presentation (MEUC102) for all first-year Mechanical,
Civil and Electrical Engineering students on *19th April, 2025, Saturday*.

Please keep the following points in mind:

   1. The topic will be informed to you by next week. The topic, once
   fixed, will not be changed later.
   2. The weightage will be 10 marks as lab component.
   3. The size of the poster will be *A2 size*. The sample format is
   attached here for your reference. Don't change the size of the poster
   sample. You only need to insert the images and the text related to your
   topic, convert to PDF and take print on A2 size.
   4. Please convey your group (*max 2 in one group*) to your class CR [
   Vishwesh (24ME057) in Mechanical, Dhyey (24CL008) in Civil+ME, Priyansh
   (24EE004) in Electrical]
   5. Any other point, if needed, will be shared with you later.


Thank you.

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

Assistant Professor

Charotar University of Science & Technology

+91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in

subject: Online Lecture Schedule for AIML, EE, IT, CSE, CL, and ME Students
snippet: Dear Students, This is to inform you about the upcoming online lecture schedule on Saturdays for the following departments: AIML, EE, IT ‚Äì 1 and 2 Date: 12th April ( Saturday ) Time: 10:00 AM to 12:00
content:
*Dear Students,*

This is to inform you about the *upcoming online lecture schedule on
Saturdays* for the following departments:
------------------------------
*AIML, EE, IT ‚Äì   1 and 2*

   -

   *Date:* 12th April ( Saturday  )
   *Time:* 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM
   -

   *Date:* 13th April (Sunday)
   *Time:* 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM

------------------------------
*CSE-1, CSE-2, CL, ME*

   -

   *Date:* 12th April ( Saturday  )
   *Time:* 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM
   -

   *Date:* 19th April ( Saturday  )
   *Time:* 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM

*Important Instructions:*

   -

   The *Microsoft Teams link* will be shared with you via email *on the day
   of the lecture*.
   -

   *Attendance is compulsory.*
   -

   You must *keep your camera turned on* throughout the entire session.
   -

   Ensure a *stable internet connection* and join the meeting on time.

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
Assistant Professor


*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-reg.
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in> Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05 am Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025 (NICE-25)-
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: AICTE <no-reply@sampark.gov.in>
Date: Sun, 30 Mar, 2025, 5:05‚ÄØam
Subject: Participation in National Inter-College Crossword Expedition 2025
(NICE-25)-reg.


Having trouble reading this email? View it in your mobile/ web browser
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/campaigns/2025/26-Mar/AICTE1/index.html>
------------------------------

Respected Sir/Madam,

Crossword-solving is a powerful cognitive exercise that enhances analytical
thinking, decision-making, memory, concentration, and creativity. It
strengthens problem-solving abilities, fosters a competitive spirit, and
expands vocabulary‚Äîskills essential for academic and professional success.

To further promote this engaging and intellectually stimulating activity in
higher education institutions, AICTE, Extra-C, IIM Mumbai, and IIT Madras
have collaborated under an MoU signed on May 21, 2024. As part of this
initiative, the *National Inter-College Crossword Expedition (NICE-25)* is
being organized.

The competition, scheduled between *May and August 2025*, will follow a
hybrid format‚Äîonline preliminary rounds leading to offline zonal and
national finals. This event provides students with an opportunity to
sharpen their minds while competing on a national platform.

*Attached are the competition guidelines, format, and tentative schedule. *The
MoU can be accessed on the AICTE website. We invite your esteemed
institution to encourage participation in this unique and enriching
challenge https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
.

*Registrations will begin from 30th March
2025 on  https://nice.crypticsingh.com
<https://jan-sampark.nic.in/jansampark/click.jsp?tab=pmo&urlid=19b602f5a3c2a21c88f676f16f1c8a8f3597377f&lat=2025&mid=5f55acd9f6411101c52d5d0f329a340aeeba95cf>
. *

PFA:-

subject: A request to share the word-of-mouth regarding BA English and BLIS at CHARUSAT University
snippet: Dear Students, I hope this email finds you well. We are excited to announce that CHARUSAT University has launched BA English and BLIS programs from the academic year 2025-2026. Industry-oriented BA
content:
Dear Students,

I hope this email finds you well.

We are excited to announce that *CHARUSAT* University has launched *BA
English and BLIS programs from the academic year 2025-2026. *
Industry-oriented BA English program is designed to provide students with
an enriching experience in the world of *English literature and language
and Literature.* *If someone in your circle or relation is passionate about
exploring English literature, enhancing language skills, or looking to
build a promising career in this field, this program offers a perfect
opportunity.*

*Who should consider this BA English program?*

If someone you know has recently passed or appeared for the *12th exam in
any stream - Arts, Commerce, or Science* and is eager to embark on an
academic journey through the lens of English studies, we encourage you to
explore the benefits of enrolling in our BA English program to the
potential candidate.

*Career Opportunities:*

A degree in BA English opens up numerous career avenues, such as:

   - Content Writing
   - Journalism & Media
   - Teaching & Education
   - Translation & Interpretation
   - Public Relations & Corporate Communication
   - Publishing & Editing
   - Advertising & Marketing
   - Corporate Training & Development
   - Entrepreneurship
   - Soft Skills Trainer
   - Competitive Exam Coaching
   - IELTS trainers and many more

*Why choose CHARUSAT for your BA English degree?*

At CHARUSAT, under the *Faculty of Humanities*, we are committed to
providing an education that not only develops linguistic proficiency but
also sharpens critical thinking, creativity, and communication skills which
are highly valued in today‚Äôs job market. Our faculty, modern
infrastructure, and vibrant campus environment will ensure that students
receive a well-rounded and rewarding experience.

*Where/How to contact for Admission?*

*If you know any aspirant who is looking for the right institute to pursue
their passion for English, please share this information with them. For
admission enquiries, student aspirants may do the following:*

For admission visit to:

https://admission.charusat.ac.in/Registration.aspx



For admission Enquiry, Scan QR code or Click on the given link and fill in
the details. We will reach out to you.
[image: IMG-20250127-WA0011 (1).jpg]



Link: https://forms.gle/hNkr58XZSKKci35w5

For direct interaction, contact at:

+91 98793 34259


Thank you for your kindness and for spreading the word!

With Regards,

Pranjal Bhatt

--

>> All Student Coordinators Kindly Forward this Mail to Your Respective
>> Department.
>>
>> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>>
>> Dear NSS Family,
>>
>> I hope you are doing well!
>>
>> We have an exciting opportunity to *showcase the impactful work of **CHARUSAT
>> NSS Cell* and *students engaged in social service* at the *national
>> level* through the upcoming newsletter. If you or your team have
>> conducted any *success story or innovative activity* in *March 2025*,
>>
>> we encourage you to share the details in a *proper document format*
>> along with *high-definition action photos.*
>>
>> To ensure consistency in submissions, please follow the *document format*
>> attached below while preparing your report. Kindly make sure the details
>> are well-documented, covering key aspects such as *objectives,
>> execution, impact, and testimonials*.
>>
>> üìå *Submission Deadline:* *3rd April 2025*
>> üì© *Send your entries to:* *23ec113@charusat.edu.in*
>>
>> This is a wonderful opportunity to bring recognition to our efforts and
>> inspire others at the national level. Looking forward to your valuable
>> submissions!
>>
>> With Regards,
>>
>> *Dhruv Rupapara*
>>
>> *Student Coordinator - NSS Cell *| *Social Media Manager & Content Lead

subject: New assignment: "Week-5"
snippet: Notification settings 24ME-EE-CL New assignment Week-5 1. List Manipulation: Given numbers = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50], write code to:Replace the second element with 25.Print the last three elements using
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24me083@charusat.edu.in&Email=24me083@charusat.edu.in>
24ME-EE-CL  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzM3NDE4ODMwODEw?email%3D24me083@charusat.edu.in&Email=24me083@charusat.edu.in>
New assignment

Week-5
1. List Manipulation: Given numbers = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50], write code  
to:Replace the second element with 25.Print the last three elements using  
slicing.Double each element using list comprehension.
2. Tuple Manipulation: Given coordinates = (10, 20, 30, 40, 50), write code  
to:Attempt to replace the second element with 25 (observe the  
error).Convert the tuple to a list, modify it, and convert back to a  
tuple.Print the last three elements using slicing.
3. Set Manipulation:  Given unique_numbers = {10, 20, 30, 40, 50}, write  
code to:Add 60 to the set.Remove 30 from the set.Create a new set with each  
element squared.
4. Dictionary Manipulation: Given inventory = {"apples": 50, "bananas":  
25, "oranges": 30}, write code to:Update the quantity of "bananas" to  
40.Add a new item, "grapes" with quantity 35.Print items with a quantity >  
30.
Instructions

    - Write your ID number, aim, actual code, and output in an ipynb file as  
discussed in the lab session.
    - To download an ipynb file in Google Colab, go to the file menu and  
download the ipynb file.
    - The file name must be your ID number.
    - Feel free to contact me for any queries.
    - For every program, the first line will be the print function, which  
will print your ID number.

Due Apr 8
See details  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzM3NDE4ODMwODEw/a/NzUzMzU5NjE5MjU1/details?email%3D24me083@charusat.edu.in&Email=24me083@charusat.edu.in>
Posted on 3:11 PM, Apr 1 (GMT+05:30) by Mikin Patel

Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043 USA

subject: Recruitment For Nakshatra Aerospace
snippet: Hello everyone! üöÄ Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Department As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
content:
*Hello everyone! üöÄ*

Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics &
Communication and Mechanical Department

As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
development on the Propulsion Systems, Design, Avionics, Recovery and
Material Science

*NOTE* :
DEADLINE FOR REGISTRATION ARE EXTENDED TILL 7th April 2025


*Why Join Us?*

Being part of Nakshatra Aerospace means you‚Äôll engage in hands-on projects,
collaborate with like-minded peers, and prepare for interviews with
industry leaders. Plus, it‚Äôs a fantastic way to enhance your resume!
Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible opportunity to soar high with Nakshatra
Aerospace! üåå

Looking forward to seeing your applications!

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeqw-dwcGPZxyFV196urPrrAdpQljpJn72pVQy4-0QQjfVExQ/viewform?usp=header


For further Queries you can Contact:

nakshatraaerospaceclub@gmail.com

Hitarth Chauhan(24ME006)
+91 7405312628
Vishwesh Patel(24ME057)
+91 9726798232

subject: Due tomorrow: "Week-4"
snippet: Notification settings 24ME-EE-CL Due tomorrow Week-4 Write a Python program to count vowels and consonants in a string.Write a Python program to reverse a string.Write a Python program to check if a
content:
Notification settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24me083@charusat.edu.in&Email=24me083@charusat.edu.in>
24ME-EE-CL  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzM3NDE4ODMwODEw?email%3D24me083@charusat.edu.in&Email=24me083@charusat.edu.in>
Due tomorrow

Week-4
Write a Python program to count vowels and consonants in a string.Write a  
Python program to reverse a string.Write a Python program to check if a  
string is a palindrome.Write a Python program to Find the Longest Word in a  
String.Write a Python program to replace all occurrences of a  
substringInstructions

    - Write your ID number, aim, actual code, and output in an ipynb file as  
discussed in the lab session.
    - To download an ipynb file in Google Colab, go to the file menu and  
download the ipynb file.
    - file name must be your ID number.
    - Feel free to contact me for any queries.
    - For every program, the first line will be the print function, which  
will print your ID number.

Due Mar 31
View assignment  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzM3NDE4ODMwODEw/a/NzUyNzU5MDM3MDg0/submissions/by-status/and-sort-last-name/all?email%3D24me083@charusat.edu.in&Email=24me083@charusat.edu.in>

Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043 USA
This email was sent to you because you indicated that you'd like to receive  
email notifications from Google Classroom. If you don't want to receive  
emails like this, you can unsubscribe or change your settings  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/s?email%3D24me083@charusat.edu.in&Email=24me083@charusat.edu.in>.

subject: Re: Online Quiz 1 Notification for Engineering Physics - 2 (Experiments 5 to 9)
snippet: Dear First-Year BTech Students, This is a reminder for today's quiz on Engineering Physics‚Äî2 subject. The previous mail may provide other details. Link for online Quiz 1: https://forms.gle/
content:
Dear First-Year BTech Students,

This is a reminder for today's quiz on Engineering Physics‚Äî2 subject. The
previous mail may provide other details.

Link for online Quiz 1: https://forms.gle/o1stbtwagHFtuZBJ7

The link will start working sharply at 4:00 PM.

Regards
Sanni

On Mon, Mar 24, 2025 at 9:52‚ÄØAM Sanni <sannikapatel.phys@charusat.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear First-Year Students,
>
> The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for
> Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the
> details below:
>
> *Date:* 29/03/2025
>
> *Day:* Saturday
>
> *Time:* 4:00 PM to 4:30 PM
>
> *Mode:* Online (Google Form)
>
> *Total Marks:* 25 MCQs
>
> *Evaluation Component:* Continuous Assessment
>
> The Google Form link for the quiz will be shared on the day of the exam. I
> just wanted to let you know that *no excuses related to internet*
> connectivity issues will be entertained. Just so you know, this quiz is
> part of your *continuous evaluation*, and failing to attempt it will
> significantly impact your overall grades as per NEP.
>
> The components for internal evaluation (25 Marks).

> Quiz 1
>

>
> Lab Manual
>
> Journal
>

> 20%
>
> 20%
>

>> Dear Students,
>>
>> Please find the syllabus for 1st Internal (sessional) exam for BCME
>>
>> *1.*
>>
>> *Introduction of Mechanical Engineering*
>>
>> *06 Hours*
>>
>> *13%*
>>
>> 1.1
>>
>> Prime movers and its types, sources of energy
>>
>> 1.2
>>
>> Basic terminology: force and mass, pressure, work, power, energy, heat,
>> temperature, units of heat, specific heat capacity, interchange of heat,
>> change of state, internal energy, enthalpy, entropy, efficiency
>>
>> 1.3
>>
>> Zeroth law and first law of thermodynamics, Boyle‚Äôs law, Charle‚Äôs law and
>> combined gas law, Relation between Cp and Cv
>>
>> 1.4
>>
>> Constant volume process, constant pressure process, isothermal process,
>> poly-tropic process, adiabatic process
>>
>> 1.5
>>
>> Numerical practice
>>
>>
>> *2.*
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> *Steam and Steam Generator*
>>
>> 2.1
>>
>> Introduction to steam formation and its types
>>
>> 2.2
>>
>> Introduction to steam table
>>
>> 2.4
>>
>> Boiler definition and its classification
>>
>> 2.5
>>
>> Cochran boiler, Babcock and Wilcox boiler and its mountings and
>> accessories *(Lab Exp. 1 & 2)*
>>
>> 2.6
>>
>> Efficiencies of boiler
>>
>> *7.                  Scope of Civil Engineering*
>> 7.1               Scope of Civil engineering
>> 7.2               Branches of civil engineering,
>> 7.3                Role of civil engineer
>>
>> *8.                 Introduction to Surveying*
>> 8.1               Definition of surveying
>> 8.2              Objects of surveying, uses of surveying
>> 8.3              Primary divisions of surveying, principles of surveying
>> --
>>
>> Best Regards,
>>
>>
>>
>> Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)
>>
>> Assistant Professor
>>
>> Charotar University of Science & Technology
>>
>> +91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in
>>

content:
*Subject:* Quiz Link and Submission Guidelines

Dear Students,

Here is your quiz link. Please log in using your Charusat email ID.

Kindly note that if* multiple responses are submitted from the same ID,
only the first response will be considered. If you have any query please
contact Dr. Niru Patel. *

snippet: Thanks for filling out Attitude of CHARUSAT Students towards Courses on Liberal Arts Here's what was received. Attitude of CHARUSAT Students towards Courses on Liberal Arts Your email (24me083@
content:
Google Forms


Thanks for filling out Attitude of CHARUSAT Students towards Courses on  
Liberal Arts
Here's what was received.


Attitude of CHARUSAT Students towards Courses on Liberal Arts


Your email (24me083@charusat.edu.in) was recorded when you submitted this  
form.


Student Name *


Vadhvana siddhi tarunkumar


Student ID
*


24ME083


Institute/College *


CSPIT



Course *


B.Tech



Specialization/Branch *


Mechanical Engineering



Semester *


Sem-2



Liberal Arts *


Strongly agree Agree Neither agree nor disagree Disagree Strongly disagree

Liberal arts courses help me explore my creative side.


Liberal arts subjects feel irrelevant to my career goals.


Liberal arts courses add diversity to the university curriculum.


The inclusion of liberal arts subjects enhances the overall university  
experience.


I believe liberal arts courses should be optional for students in technical  
fields.


I enjoy participating in activities during liberal arts classes.


Liberal arts courses are exciting and fun.


Liberal arts courses encourage me to express my individuality.


Attending liberal arts classes is a refreshing change from my technical  
subjects.


Liberal arts courses have improved my creative problem-solving skills.


Liberal arts courses enhance my ability to work on team projects.


Liberal arts courses have made me more confident in public speaking.


Skills gained in liberal arts courses can be applied in my daily life.


The knowledge gained in liberal arts courses is relevant to modern  
professional settings.


I find it challenging to see the practical applications of liberal arts  
courses in my career.


Liberal arts education is essential for holistic personal and professional  
growth.


The creative assignments in liberal arts courses are harder than they seem.


Liberal arts courses should include a mix of theory and practical work for  
balanced learning.


Liberal arts courses have helped me appreciate diverse cultures and  
perspectives.


Liberal arts classes encourage collaboration and teamwork.


The teaching methods used in liberal arts courses are innovative and  
engaging.


Liberal arts faculty inspire creativity in their students.


My peers perceive liberal arts courses as less serious compared to  
technical courses.


Liberal arts courses provide a platform for socializing and networking.


Experiences in liberal arts courses build transferable skills that are  
valuable in any career.


Participating in liberal arts activities will enhance my resume or  
portfolio.


The ability to think creatively, gained from liberal arts, will help me  
adapt to diverse challenges.


Liberal arts education contributes to building a well-rounded personality.


More hands-on workshops and guest lectures would make liberal arts courses  
more appealing.


Interdisciplinary projects involving liberal arts and technical students  
would foster collaboration.


Subjects Studied *


HSUS102 Photography



HSUS102 Photography


HSUS102 Photography *


Strongly agree Agree Neither agree nor disagree Disagree Strongly disagree

This course has given me a solid understanding of essential photography  
tools and techniques.


I feel confident using different photography equipment after completing  
this course.


Learning about various photographic techniques has improved my ability to  
capture high-quality images.


The hands-on training in this course has enhanced my technical skills in  
photography.


I have gained a strong understanding of how to control aperture, shutter  
speed, and film speed to create well-exposed images.


This course has helped me understand the role of depth of field and  
movement in composing a great photograph.


I now feel confident adjusting camera settings to achieve the desired  
photographic effect.


Learning about light meters has improved my ability to measure and  
manipulate light in photography.


The final project has helped me apply what I learned to create a  
well-structured photographic concept.


I feel that my final photography project effectively demonstrates my growth  
as a photographer.


Working on a unified photographic idea has strengthened my ability to  
create cohesive visual narratives.


The guidance provided throughout the project helped me refine my creative  
and technical photography skills.


This course has expanded my understanding of different photographic  
representation styles such as appropriation and mixed media.


Experimenting with digital media has allowed me to explore new creative  
possibilities in photography.


Learning about persona and non-objective photography has broadened my  
artistic vision.


The course has encouraged me to experiment with unconventional photographic  
techniques.


This course has helped me understand how to use artificial and mixed  
lighting effectively in photography.


I feel confident in creating a photography portfolio that showcases my  
creative lighting techniques.


The assignments on lighting have enhanced my ability to manipulate light to  
achieve specific visual effects.


My photography portfolio reflects the skills and creativity I developed  
throughout this course.

snippet: Dear Students, Please open the following link to appear in Photography University Exam Quiz (20 Marks): Link: https://forms.gle/Fn5HnvYNQBvL3H8LA Note: Kindly use your institute email ID only and enter
content:
Dear Students,

Please open the following link to appear in Photography University Exam
Quiz (20 Marks):

Link: https://forms.gle/Fn5HnvYNQBvL3H8LA

Note: Kindly use your institute email ID only and enter the correct ID
number i.e. 24DIT002

30 Minutes will be given to you to submit your responses.

Once you complete the quiz, take a screenshot of the submission and show it
to the examiner when you come for Viva and photo submission. In case of any
network issue, you may use the hot-spot of your classmates.

You must be at your venue while you appear in the quiz.

All the best!

With regards,
*Pranjal Bhatt*
*Assistant Professor*
*Faculty of Humanities*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management*
*CHARUSAT University, Changa, India.*
*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC*

subject: Share Your Valuable Feedback on the Photography Workshop
snippet: Dear Students, We are delighted to have successfully conducted the Photography Workshop across four mega venues, reaching and educating 1060+ students with the best learning experience possible. Now,
content:
Dear Students,

We are delighted to have successfully conducted the *Photography Workshop*
 across *four mega venues*, reaching and educating *1060+ students* with
the best learning experience possible.

Now, it‚Äôs time for your feedback! Your positive feedback will help us
continue bringing such unique workshops in the future.
Once you complete the feedback, take a screenshot of the submission and
show it to the examiner when you come for Viva and photo submission. In
case of any network issue, you may use the hot-spot of your classmates. You
must be at your venue while you appear in the quiz.

Please take a moment to share your feedback by filling out the Google Form
below:

Link: https://forms.gle/7BqSKCFmtfou8Bod7

Your support and feedback mean a lot to us.

*Thank you for being a part of this learning journey!*

With regards,
*Pranjal Bhatt*
*Assistant Professor*
*Faculty of Humanities*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management*
*CHARUSAT University, Changa, India.*
*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC*

--

subject: Important: University Exam Scheduled Tomorrow ‚Äì Photography Workshop
snippet: Dear Students, Please be informed that the University Exam for HSUS102: Photography is scheduled tomorrow (ie March 28, 2025), on the 4th day of the Photography Workshop of Liberal Art 2025. It is
content:
Dear Students,

Please be informed that the *University Exam for HSUS102: Photography* is
scheduled *tomorrow (i.e. March 28, 2025)*, on the *4th day of the
Photography Workshop of Liberal Art 2025*.

*It is mandatory for all students to be present for the exam, as no re-exam
will be conducted. Absence will result in a backlog.*

*Exam Pattern:*

¬∑        *Photo Assessment: 40 Marks*

¬∑        *Viva: 40 Marks*

¬∑        *Quiz: 20 Marks*

The *reference material* is attached for your preparation.

Also refer to the content of online course assigned on Day-1

The detailed schedule is attached herewith for your reference.

For any queries, please reach out at the earliest.

All the best!


With regards,
*Pranjal Bhatt*
*Assistant Professor*
*Faculty of Humanities*
*Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management*
*CHARUSAT University, Changa, India.*
*Accredited with "Grade A+" by NAAC*

*Contact: 9429296329*

--

subject: Regarding Poster Presentation for BCME (MEUC102) on 19th April, 2025, Saturday
snippet: Dear Students, Hope this mail finds you well. CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering is going to organize the Poster presentation (MEUC102) for all first-year Mechanical, Civil and
content:
Dear Students,

Hope this mail finds you well.

CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering is going to
organize the Poster presentation (MEUC102) for all first-year Mechanical,
Civil and Electrical Engineering students on *19th April, 2025, Saturday*.

Please keep the following points in mind:

   1. The topic will be informed to you by next week. The topic, once
   fixed, will not be changed later.
   2. The weightage will be 10 marks as lab component.
   3. The size of the poster will be *A2 size*. The sample format is
   attached here for your reference. Don't change the size of the poster
   sample. You only need to insert the images and the text related to your
   topic, convert to PDF and take print on A2 size.
   4. Please convey your group (*max 2 in one group*) to your class CR [
   Vishwesh (24ME057) in Mechanical, Dhyey (24CL008) in Civil+ME, Priyansh
   (24EE004) in Electrical]
   5. Any other point, if needed, will be shared with you later.


Thank you.

Best Regards,



Dr. Abhishek Swarnkar (M.Tech.| PhD)

Assistant Professor

Charotar University of Science & Technology

+91 90992 23998 | abhishekswarnkar.me@charusat.ac.in

subject: Urmil & Mayuri Desai Family Trust Scholarship for 1st Year Students for the academic year (2024-25) of B.Tech Program.
snippet: Dear First Year CSPIT Students, We are pleased to announce Urmil & Mayuri Desai Family Trust Scholarship which will be awarded to the students of 1 st year of B.Tech program for academic year 2024-
content:
Dear First Year CSPIT Students,


We are pleased to announce Urmil & Mayuri Desai Family Trust Scholarship
which will be awarded to the students of 1st year of B.Tech program for
academic year 2024-25, with the following Criteria:



*Eligibility Criteria to get Scholarship for the Academic Year 2024-25:*

v Students of *1st Semester (1st year)* who have secured 75 percentage or
above in the 12th standard.

v Students whose family income is not more than 6.5 lacs.

v To continue to be eligible for availing Scholarship, the Student has to
secure 7.00 CGPA or above at the end of every semester without backlog.

v In case, a student will not score a minimum 7.00 CGPA in consecutive
semesters, then scholarship will be awarded to another eligible student,
selected by the Donor and recommended by CHARUSAT.

v Only four students shall be selected for the scholarship each semester.
Two boys and two girls. In case applicants of either gender are not
available, then all the four beneficiaries can be boys or girls.

v Students receiving Govt. / Donor / CHARUSAT / any other scholarship or
admitted under the Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme (TFWS) are not eligible to
apply.

v The Scholarship is meant to provide *maximum support to four students
selected by Donor, based on merit-cum-means and complying above conditions.*



*Scholarship Amount:*  Per Students 17500/- per semester (maximum four
students selected by the Donor)



 P*Please find the form and notice for your ready reference. You are
requested to submit the filled form to **Mr.Yatin Talati, **Room no.101,
EE/EC Building, CSPIT.*

*Last Date of Submission of Form:   08.04.2025*

 **Note: No Form will be accepted after the last date.*

-- 
Thanks,
*Yatin Talati*

Accredited Grade ‚ÄúA+‚Äù by NAAC, GOI

Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Off. Nadiad - Petlad Highway, Changa, Gujarat, INDIA 388421
www.charusat.ac.in

--

subject: Recruitment For Nakshatra Aerospace
snippet: Hello everyone! üöÄ Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics & Communication and Mechanical Department As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
content:
*Hello everyone! üöÄ*

Nakshatra Aerospace is an Official Club under CSPIT, Electronics &
Communication and Mechanical Department

As a Member of Nakshatra Aerospace we tend to perform research and
development on the Propulsion Systems, Design, Avionics, Recovery and
Material Science

We're thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for all B.Tech students!
The Nakshatra Aerospace Club is officially recruiting new members, and we
want YOU to be a part of this Stellar journey into the world of Aerospace
innovation!


*Why Join Us?*

Being part of Nakshatra Aerospace means you‚Äôll engage in hands-on projects,
collaborate with like-minded peers, and prepare for interviews with
industry leaders. Plus, it‚Äôs a fantastic way to enhance your resume!
Don‚Äôt miss out on this incredible opportunity to soar high with Nakshatra
Aerospace! üåå

Looking forward to seeing your applications!


https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdpMxTKdA4gNtlLeGDoM0W5D6Ch-tKuZQnDJlMonw97xbJpGQ/viewform

For further Queries you can Contact:

Kindly report to the  venue of *PDPIAS by 9.10 Am* tomorrow.

Tomorrow, there will be 2 Fieldwork, a Photography competition, and an
evaluation of 40 marks.

With regards,
*Pranjal Bhatt*
*Assistant Professor*
*Faculty of Humanities*

subject: Important: Online Quiz Scheduled on March 29th ‚Äì Instructions Inside
snippet: Dear Students, The first online quiz is scheduled for March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM. Please keep the following points in mind: The quiz consists of 5 MCQs and must be completed within 10 minutes.
content:
*Dear Students,*

The first online quiz is scheduled for *March 29th from 11:20 to 11:30 AM*.
Please keep the following points in mind:

   1.

   The quiz consists of *5 MCQs* and must be completed within *10 minutes*.
   2.

   Incorrect *ID inputs* will not be considered and will result in *zero
   marks*.
   3.

   Ensure you are in a *stable network environment*. Any *network or
   technical issues will not be considered*.
   4.

   The *Google Form link* will be sent to you via email on the day of the
   quiz.
   5.

   Login is allowed *only* using your *Charusat email ID*.
   6.

   For any queries, please write an email.

Best regards,
*Dr. Bina Patel*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences *
*PDPIAS, CHARUSAT, Changa-388421*
*Accredited Grade A+ by NAAC*

*Mob. No: **+91-9427777856  *
*‡§µ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ß‡•à‡§µ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ü‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ï‡§Æ*

subject: crammer rule is not allowed in semster 2
snippet: Dear Students You are not allowed to use the crammer rule while finding the Eigen Vector. You can take the help of Gauss elimination or Gauss Jordan Method or simplification of equations. If you wish
content:
Dear Students
*You are not allowed to use the crammer rule while finding the Eigen
Vector. *
You can take the help of Gauss elimination or Gauss Jordan Method or
simplification of equations.

If you wish to see your answer book, you can consult me in
the staffroom between 09:10 to 12:15 and 2:20 to 04:30.

*Thanks and regards,*
*Rajesh V. Savalia *
*PhD, MPhil*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences*
*P. D. Patel Institute of Applied **Sciences*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology*
*Accredited Grade 'A+' by NAAC *
*Website: https://www.charusat.ac.in/ <https://www.charusat.ac.in/>*
*M. No. 94292 22899*

--

subject: Join NSS Today! Empower Yourself & Make a Difference üå±‚ú®
snippet: Dear Mechanical Family, Jay Hind !! Greetings from NSS Unit... We are excited to offer you a chance to be part of something bigger than yourself! We are thrilled to invite you to become a part of the
content:
Dear Mechanical Family,

Jay Hind !! Greetings from NSS Unit...

We are excited to offer you a chance to be part of something bigger than
yourself!

We are thrilled to invite you to become a part of the National Service
Scheme (NSS)‚Äîa vibrant platform that empowers you to contribute to society
while honing your leadership skills and social responsibility.

*Why Join NSS?*

   - *Community Engagement*: Be at the forefront of impactful activities
   such as tree plantation drives, cleanliness campaigns, health awareness
   programs, and more.
   - *Personal Growth*: Develop your leadership and teamwork skills by
   working on projects that create real change.
   - *Certifications & Recognition*: Earn certificates and accolades that
   will enhance your academic and professional profile.
   - *Memorable Experiences*: Participate in camps, workshops, and events
   that will leave you with lasting memories and friendships.
   - Participating in NSS can enhance your resume, develop key skills and
   provide valuable networking opportunities, all of which can boost your
   profile for international scholarships and recognition.
   Additionally, NSS involvement may offer extra credits or points when
   applying for an abroad visa, strengthening your application.

   [image: image.png]

*Highlights from Last Year:*

Our NSS Unit successfully organized a range of impactful events, including:

   - *Animal Rescue Missions*
   - *Independence Day and Republic Day Celebrations*
   - *Event for Female Safety and Sexual Harassment Awareness*
   - *Har Ghar Tiranga Initiative*
   - *Run for Unity*
   - *Smile Fiesta, Happiness Day Celebration*
   - *Blood Donation Camp*
   - *Polo forest camp*
   - *Annual Camp*

This year,

*we plan to continue these initiatives and introduce new opportunities for
you to make a meaningful difference.**  For more information, check out
the NSS PDF or view the YouTube Video
<https://youtu.be/ngURdgGsjyo?si=4tZvX2Cn0vVFbYmw>.  *
------------------------------

*How to Join:*

To register, please click here <https://forms.gle/YckdKdvjgreu7jwG6>

*Please use your CHARUSAT Mail ID to sign in.*

*According to the N.S.S. Regional Office rules, each volunteer may actively
participate in the *NSS* for a maximum of two years. After completing their
two-year tenure with **240 hours **, volunteers are eligible to receive
their certificates.*
------------------------------


*If you have any questions or need more information, feel free to reach out
to us.*

Prof. Satayu Travadi : Program Officer
Jash Bhugaliya: Student Coordinator
Param Unjiya: NSS Volunteer
Or Please write to us at 23me004@charusat.edu.in

Join us in making a difference and shaping your future with NSS !!

*P.S.: Please Note that being a NSS Volunteer is Different From the CESD
Course. *

--


*Thanks & Warm Regards,**Jash Bhungaliya*
*2nd Year B.Tech. ME*
*NSS Student Coordinator*
CHAMOS Matrusanstha Department of Mechanical Engineering (Estd. 2001)
*CSPIT, CHARUSAT, Changa 388421*

subject: Re: Collection of Photography KIT
snippet: Dear Students, It is a gentle reminder for the workshop on Photography scheduled from tomorrow. Kindly ensure that you attend all four days workshop without fail as your internal and external exam
content:
Dear Students,

It is a gentle reminder for the workshop on Photography scheduled from
tomorrow.

Kindly ensure that you attend all four days workshop without fail as your
internal and external exam evaluation will be done within these four days
only.

We have already provided the needed documents in your photography Kit, and
they are attached to this email. Kindly study them thoroughly.

Carry your ID card without fail.

In case you have not collected your Kit of Photography yet, do it now and
collect it from Room 220, First Floor, IIIM Building before 3:00 PM today

*Refer to Day-1 Time-table and reach your Day-1 Venue by 9:10 am tomorrow
without fail.*


With regards,

Kaushik Trivedi

On Tue, Mar 18, 2025 at 5:43‚ÄØPM Kaushik Trivedi <
kaushiktrivedi.cs@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> *Kindly collect your Photography Kit tomorrow (i.e. March 19, 2025), from
> Room No. 220, First Floor, IIIM Building (Beside Sports Ground) as per the
> following  time slot without fail:*
>
>    - *01:20 am - 04:20 pm*
>
> With regards,
>
> Kaushik Trivedi
>
> On Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:13‚ÄØAM Kaushik Trivedi <
> kaushiktrivedi.cs@charusat.ac.in> wrote:
>
>> Dear Students,
>>
>>
>> Good Morning!
>>
>>
>> This email is with reference to your liberal arts course registration on
>> *E-Governance. * You have enrolled yourself for the *Photography
>> (HSUS102)* course.
>>
>>
>>
>> We are excited to welcome you to the *Photography* course as part of a
>> course on *Liberal Arts*.
>>
>> Please be informed that all the *Liberal Arts Courses (HSUS101-117)* will
>> be taught in the Workshop Mode. *The dates for the Workshop are March
>> 25-28, 2025.*
>>
>>
>> *Please make a note of following:*
>>
>> 1.      The Course Workshop will be offered/conducted in a *Workshop
>> Mode from 9:10 am to 4:30 pm* from March 25 to 28, 2025 (All four days).
>>
>> 2.      It is a 2-credit course and compulsory to attend the workshop on
>> said dates without fail.
>>
>> 3.      *If a student fails to attend the workshop or complete the exam,
>> tasks, activities and assignments, he/she may fail in the course and get a
>> backlog.*
>>
>> 4.      Students are required to collect a Kit. It will be available at
>> Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management on Monday - March 24, 2025 (from
>> 9:30 am to 4:00 pm) in different slots. Your Institute/Department faculty
>> members will guide you for the same.
>>
>> 5.      Students must bring the Kit daily and take care of the materials
>> and instruments given to them. In case, if something is lost, concerned
>> students will be required to manage it.
>>
>> 6.      100% Attendance is Compulsory.
>>
>> 7.      The detailed day-wise schedule and SoP will be shared soon. Students
>> need to report in Time (at least 10 minutes before the stipulated time).
>>
>> 8.      Students must perform the Practical or do the tasks as assigned
>> to them.
>>
>> 9.      As the external Resource Persons are invited, students are also
>> required to maintain discipline and decorum befitting the students of a
>> university and professional programs.
>>
>> 10.  It is required that every student carries their own Identity Card.
>>
>> 11.  During the Workshop, students‚Äô day-wise submissions will also be
>> taken.
>>
>> 12.  *Internal Evaluation as well as External University Exam will be
>> carried out during these four days only.*
>>
>> 13.  Details of the Syllabus of the opted Course, evaluation scheme and
>> other instructions will be provided to the students in their kit as well as
>> via email.
>>
>> 14.  Strictly follow the instructions/guidance given by the Resource
>> Persons / Faculty Coordinators.
>>
>>
>> *In case of any queries or concerns, you may reply to this email or
>> contact me (Dr. Kaushik Trivedi) on  +91 92656 20055.*
>>
>>
>>
>> With regards,
>>
>>
>> Dr. Kaushik Trivedi
>>
>> Course Coordinator (Photography)
>>
>> Liberal Arts - 2025
>>
>

--

subject: Online Quiz 1 Notification for Engineering Physics - 2 (Experiments 5 to 9)
snippet: Dear First-Year Students, The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the details below: Date: 29/03/2025 Day:
content:
Dear First-Year Students,

The Department of Physical Sciences is conducting an online quiz for
Engineering Physics - 2, covering Experiments 5 to 9. Please find the
details below:

*Date:* 29/03/2025

*Day:* Saturday

*Time:* 4:00 PM to 4:30 PM

*Mode:* Online (Google Form)

*Total Marks:* 25 MCQs

*Evaluation Component:* Continuous Assessment

The Google Form link for the quiz will be shared on the day of the exam. I
just wanted to let you know that *no excuses related to internet*
connectivity issues will be entertained. Just so you know, this quiz is
part of your *continuous evaluation*, and failing to attempt it will
significantly impact your overall grades as per NEP.

The components for internal evaluation (25 Marks).

Quiz 1

Quiz 2

Lab Manual

Journal

20%

20%

20%

40%

Ensure your availability and preparedness for the quiz. For any queries,
feel free to reach out to your lab-in-charge for further assistance.

Best regards,
Sanni


-- 
*Thanks,*



*Sanni, Ph.D.Assistant professorDepartment of Physical Sciences
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/PDPIAS/people/>Faculty of Applied SciencesP D
Patel Institute of Applied Sciences,CHARUSAT
<https://www.charusat.ac.in/>, Changa. - 388 421, India*

*Email: sannikapatel.phys@charusat.ac.in <sannikapatel.phys@charusat.ac.in>*
*            sunkapatel@gmail.com <sunkapatel@gmail.com>*
*Phone: (M) +91 - 9978577009*

--

subject: Re: Assignment submission of AIML and ME div 1 and 2
snippet: Dear all Pls note that you can submit your book at 09:10 Am in the staff room and collect it from me after 02:30 PM as per your convenience. Make sure the following things: 1) Write the title and the
content:
Dear all
Pls note that you can submit your book at 09:10 Am in the staff room and
collect it from me after 02:30 PM as per your convenience.
Make sure the following things:
1) Write *the title and the number* of the example word to word as given in
the assignment.
2) Each end of every example must be solved.
3) Incomplete assignment will not be considered and in such case, students
have to write an incomplete assignment* 05 times*
4) If you cannot solve any example *not all example*, then put a blank
space and I will help to solve it.


*Thanks and regards,*
*Rajesh V. Savalia *
*PhD, MPhil*
*Assistant Professor*
*Department of Mathematical Sciences*
*P. D. Patel Institute of Applied **Sciences*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology*
*Accredited Grade 'A+' by NAAC *
*Website: https://www.charusat.ac.in/ <https://www.charusat.ac.in/>*
*M. No. 94292 22899*

subject: Re: C-Quest Hackathon
snippet: Dear Students, This is a final reminder that the registration will close today at 1:00 PM. After this time, the form will be closed, and no further entries will be accepted. Please complete the
content:
Dear Students,

This is a final reminder that the registration will close *today at 1:00
PM.* After this time, the form will be closed, and no further entries will
be accepted.

Please complete the registration before the deadline to avoid any
inconvenience.
*Thank you,*
*Srushti Gajjar,*
*Department of Computer Science & Engineering*
*Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology(CSPIT)*
*Charotar University of Science and Technology(CHARUSAT)*


On Mon, Mar 17, 2025 at 5:34‚ÄØPM Jigar Sarda <jigarsarda.ee@charusat.ac.in>
wrote:

> *Dear Students,*
>
> The Department of Computer Science and Engineering, CSPIT, is excited to
> present *C-Quest Hackathon* in collaboration with the *IEEE Computer
> Society, CHARUSAT and TechGenius Club*‚Äîan exhilarating competition aimed
> at *fostering innovation and advanced programming in C.*
> This is your chance to participate in C-QUEST ‚Äì Battle of the Best, an exclusive
> coding competition for first-year students, where you can showcase your C
> programming skills, compete with top talent, and contribute to impactful
> programming that shapes the future of development. Designed to challenge
> your problem-solving abilities, debugging skills, and algorithmic thinking,
> this hackathon offers an exciting opportunity to test your knowledge and
> compete against the brightest minds!*Why Should You Participate?*
>
> ‚úÖ *Test Your Skills:* Solve challenging C programming problems
> ‚úÖ *Sharpen Your Logic:* Tackle algorithmic puzzles and debugging tasks
> ‚úÖ *Win Exciting Prizes:* Get rewarded for your coding excellence
> ‚úÖ *Network with Peers:* Meet like-minded coding enthusiasts
> ‚úÖ *Boost Your Resume:* A great addition to your programming portfolio
> *Event Details*
>
> üìÖ *Date:* 5th April 2025
> ‚è∞ *Time:* 9:00 AM ‚Äì 4:00 PM
> üìç *Venue:* Chandubhai S. Patel Institute of Technology (CSPIT), CHARUSAT
> üë• *Who Can Participate?* First-year students passionate about coding
> üéØ *Eligibility:* *Teams of 2 members (Interdepartmental teams of the
> same institute are allowed)*
>
> Whether you're a *beginner or already confident* in C programming, this
> event is a fantastic opportunity to *learn, compete, and grow* in a
> supportive and thrilling environment.
>
> üìå *How to Register?*
> Simply *scan the QR code* in the attached flyer or reach out to us for
> registration details!
>
> *Last date of registration: 20th March 2025.*
>
> Looking forward to your participation!
>
> *Best regards,*
> *CSPIT-CSE*
> [image: C.png]
>

snippet: Dear All, The students who have not collected their photography kit today, they may collect it tomorrow, between 11:10 am - 12:30 pm, from Room No. 220, First Floor, IIIM Building. With regards,
content:
Dear All,

The students who have not collected their photography kit today, they may
collect it tomorrow, between 11:10 am - 12:30 pm, from Room No. 220, First
Floor, IIIM Building.

With regards,

Kaushik Trivedi

On Tue, Mar 18, 2025 at 5:43‚ÄØPM Kaushik Trivedi <
kaushiktrivedi.cs@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> *Kindly collect your Photography Kit tomorrow (i.e. March 19, 2025), from
> Room No. 220, First Floor, IIIM Building (Beside Sports Ground) as per the
> following  time slot without fail:*
>
>    - *01:20 am - 04:20 pm*
>
> With regards,
>
> Kaushik Trivedi
>
> On Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:13‚ÄØAM Kaushik Trivedi <
> kaushiktrivedi.cs@charusat.ac.in> wrote:
>
>> Dear Students,
>>
>>
>> Good Morning!
>>
>>
>> This email is with reference to your liberal arts course registration on
>> *E-Governance. * You have enrolled yourself for the *Photography
>> (HSUS102)* course.
>>
>>
>>
>> We are excited to welcome you to the *Photography* course as part of a
>> course on *Liberal Arts*.
>>
>> Please be informed that all the *Liberal Arts Courses (HSUS101-117)* will
>> be taught in the Workshop Mode. *The dates for the Workshop are March
>> 25-28, 2025.*
>>
>>
>> *Please make a note of following:*
>>
>> 1.      The Course Workshop will be offered/conducted in a *Workshop
>> Mode from 9:10 am to 4:30 pm* from March 25 to 28, 2025 (All four days).
>>
>> 2.      It is a 2-credit course and compulsory to attend the workshop on
>> said dates without fail.
>>
>> 3.      *If a student fails to attend the workshop or complete the exam,
>> tasks, activities and assignments, he/she may fail in the course and get a
>> backlog.*
>>
>> 4.      Students are required to collect a Kit. It will be available at
>> Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management on Monday - March 24, 2025 (from
>> 9:30 am to 4:00 pm) in different slots. Your Institute/Department faculty
>> members will guide you for the same.
>>
>> 5.      Students must bring the Kit daily and take care of the materials
>> and instruments given to them. In case, if something is lost, concerned
>> students will be required to manage it.
>>
>> 6.      100% Attendance is Compulsory.
>>
>> 7.      The detailed day-wise schedule and SoP will be shared soon. Students
>> need to report in Time (at least 10 minutes before the stipulated time).
>>
>> 8.      Students must perform the Practical or do the tasks as assigned
>> to them.
>>
>> 9.      As the external Resource Persons are invited, students are also
>> required to maintain discipline and decorum befitting the students of a
>> university and professional programs.
>>
>> 10.  It is required that every student carries their own Identity Card.
>>
>> 11.  During the Workshop, students‚Äô day-wise submissions will also be
>> taken.
>>
>> 12.  *Internal Evaluation as well as External University Exam will be
>> carried out during these four days only.*
>>
>> 13.  Details of the Syllabus of the opted Course, evaluation scheme and
>> other instructions will be provided to the students in their kit as well as
>> via email.
>>
>> 14.  Strictly follow the instructions/guidance given by the Resource
>> Persons / Faculty Coordinators.
>>
>>
>> *In case of any queries or concerns, you may reply to this email or
>> contact me (Dr. Kaushik Trivedi) on  +91 92656 20055.*
>>
>>
>>
>> With regards,
>>
>>
>> Dr. Kaushik Trivedi
>>
>> Course Coordinator (Photography)
>>
>> Liberal Arts - 2025
>>
>

--

content:
Notification settings

<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https://classroom.google.com/c/NzM3NDE4ODMwODEw&Email=24me083@charusat.edu.in>
New assignment

Week-4
Write a Python program to count vowels and consonants in a string.Write a  
Python program to reverse a string.Write a Python program to check if a  
string is a palindrome.Write a Python program to Find the Longest Word in a  
String.Write a Python program to replace all occurrences of a  
substringInstructions

    - Write your ID number, aim, actual code, and output in an ipynb file as  
discussed in the lab session.
    - To download an ipynb file in Google Colab, go to the file menu and  
download the ipynb file.
    - file name must be your ID number.
    - Feel free to contact me for any queries.
    - For every program, the first line will be the print function, which  
will print your ID number.

Due Mar 31

content:
*Dear students,*


Please find the Seating Arrangement for B.Tech-IV / VI and M.Tech - II :
Midterm Exam Starting from 24th March, 2025.

   - You are required to adhere to the seating arrangement outlined in the
   email attachment.
   - You are required to uphold decorum in the examination hall. Mobile
   phones, smartwatches, or any other electronic devices are strictly
   prohibited within the exam hall.
   - Bags must be left outside, and it is mandatory to wear an ID card.
   - You have to take your seat in the exam hall at least 15 minutes prior
   to the exam time.

*Exam Centre:  * *Exam Hall 201 (first floor) and 301 (second floor) of
Multi Utility Complex.*
--

subject: Fwd: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making Competition Details
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in> Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07 PM Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: DHRUVI MAHALE <22cs036@charusat.edu.in>
Date: Sat, Mar 15, 2025 at 9:07‚ÄØPM
Subject: Request to Forward Traffic Awareness Event & Poster Making
Competition Details
To: <coordinator.nss@charusat.ac.in>
Cc: <pinalhansora.cse@charusat.ac.in>, <22cs051@charusat.edu.in>


Respected Sir,

I hope this email finds you well.

We, the *CSE NSS Unit*, are organizing a *Traffic Awareness Program* on *20th
March 2025* to spread awareness about road safety and responsible driving
among students. As part of this initiative, we are hosting a *Poster Making
Competition* on *18th March 2025*.

üìå *Competition Details:*

   - Open to all students of *Charusat University*
   - Teams of *2 or 3 members* can participate
   - Only *20 teams* will be selected on a *first-come, first-serve* basis
   - The best posters will be showcased at the *Traffic Awareness Program*
   - *Participants must bring their own laptops for designing the poster  *

We request you to kindly forward this information to all departments so
that interested students can participate. They can register by filling out
the form linked below:

üìç *Registration Link: *https://forms.gle/nFMfduwfUAyHPfzX6

Attached is the *poster for the event* for further reference.
[image: image.png]

For any queries, students can contact:
üìû  *9328068864 **, *99790 99218

We appreciate your support in spreading the word about this initiative.
Looking forward to your kind cooperation.

Best Regards,
Dhruvi mahale



-- 
Thanks & Regards
--

--
